items.title: Redox: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer

Posted Nov 14

Redox
Headquarters: Madison, WI - Remote USA
https://www.redoxengine.com/

Redox is an engineering-first company, building the future of healthcare information exchange.  We are looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our small and fast-paced team. In this position, you'll be creating the communication platform used by the entire healthcare software developer community.

At Redox, we have a culture of trust, transparency and tireless personal growth.

Please Apply If You Are:
  • Passionate about solving complex problems and doing good
  • Intellectually curious with a genuine desire to learn
  • Experienced programming in *some* language
  • A good listener who shows respect to your colleagues
  • A believer in asking for forgiveness, not permission
  • Comfortable with uncertainty and turning complex problems into actionable plans

Responsibilities:
  • Ship elegant code
  • Ship functional features
  • Ship features often
  • Develop for the future
  • Manage your own work, yet collaborate and support your fellow team members

Preferred Experience:
  • Shipping and maintaining large-scale HA cloud applications
  • Developing/Authoring APIs or Data Schemas
  • Healthcare Experience/Interest
  • Infrastructure or AWS Experience

Our Tech
We use Angular on the front-end and node on the backend; Postgres for our main DB store and Redis to manage coordinating among our various processes. We are committed to unit testing, peer code review, and continuous deployment. Check out our full stack here: https://stackshare.io/redox-engine/redox-engine

Apply for this position

Apply through our careers page: https://www.redoxengine.com/developer-application

items.title: Full Time: Frontend React JavaScript Engineer at Trumid Technologies LLC in New York (Remote)
items.content:
The Company

Trumid is a financial technology company bringing efficiency to credit trading through data, technology and elegantly crafted products. Trumid Market Center, the company’s all-to-all electronic trading and market intelligence platform for corporate bonds, provides market professionals with direct access to anonymous liquidity.

We’re a Wall Street startup founded in 2014 and backed by Peter Thiel and George Soros, seeking an experienced Frontend React developer. We’re leading-edge in our technology approach, and offer the option to work onsite at our New York office or Remote from anywhere. Our institutional credit trading platform has a Scala microservices architecture with multiple Electron-based frontend applications.

Trumid offers excellent compensation and benefits. A Computer Science degree is preferred but not required. We are looking for someone who can demonstrate ability to keep up with the latest best-practices in the fast-moving JavaScript ecosystem.

Role responsibilities:

  • Design, implement and optimize our flagship Market Center application to improve trader experience and drive revenue
  • Work with our business team, designers and clients to deliver world-class UIs
  • Be a driving force for the adoption of modern UI architecture and best-practices on a fast-paced team environment

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript, and web UI architecture and frameworks
  • Experience building React frontend applications for production systems
  • Familiarity with Redux and middleware for asynchronous action handling
  • Understanding of reactive socket-streaming application development
  • Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases, and handling of large data sets
  • Solid understanding of HTML5/CSS3 web technologies
  • Software development experience with github, jira, jenkins, in a *nix environment
  • A passion for marketplaces and high-performance computing

Please submit a professional statement, LinkedIn profile or resume, and github or blog URL to careers@trumidtech.com to apply.

items.title: PhishMe: UI Lead Engineer
items.content:
UI Lead Engineer

Posted Nov 14

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg, VA
phishme.com/company/careers

Reporting to the Director of Software Engineering, the Lead UI Engineer is responsible for assisting with the technical oversight of the front-end architecture for the Triage product line at PhishMe. 

PhishMe provides end-to-end cyber-defense solutions that help protect organizations and their people from the vast and growing threat posed by phishing-related attacks. We're expanding rapidly and looking for talented engineers, like you, that care about building great products that solve big problems.
In this role, you will lead our efforts to rethink, refactor, and rebuild the foundations that support the front-end. You will bring to bear your passion for design and engineering towards the creation of functional and elegant experiences for our users. Working with Product Management, UX and front-end engineering teams, you will drive forward the four pillars of front-end architecture: code, documentation, testing, and process. (Ref: Micah Godbolt's collection of thoughts on Front-End Architecture: https://github.com/micahgodbolt/front-end-architecture)
  • Collaborate with the engineering teams and other stakeholders on new product features providing feasibility and estimation detail.
  • Support creation and maintenance of the technical roadmap for each product, providing relevant documentation and detail of the investments necessary to reach goals.
  • Support front-end development teams to establish shared coding standards, consistent code quality, and continuous improvement.
  • Effective communication is key and you should be able to modulate your approach to specific audiences both technical and non-technical.
  • Architecture level technical oversight of the front-end for multiple products, you will lay the groundwork for development of elegant, robust user experiences using a modern approach to the web.
  • Coordinate with back-end platform and API teams to understand impact and integrate with existing and future APIs.
  • Other duties as assigned.

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

 

  • Deep understanding of JavaScript as a language and its ecosystem, especially as it relates to front-end development for the web.
  • Familiar with multiple JavaScript frameworks like Vue.Js, ReAct.Js, Ember and Angular.
  • Longstanding familiarity with the JavaScript community -- you stay on top of current news and changes to the language and framework landscape.
  • Proficient in HTML and CSS with knowledge of web standards, advanced layouts, and responsive design.
  • Comfortable with various build tools, template languages, and pre-processors.
  • Maintains a test-centric approach to development in order to build and deploy with confidence.
  • Familiarity with component based approaches to front-end applications.
  • Demonstrated ability to make and support technical decisions as well as craft a technical roadmap to support investments to achieve a specific long term vision.
  • Excellent understanding of browser security and performance.
  • Experience with cross-browser compatibility and relevant shims, fallbacks, and polyfills.
  • Passionate about design and the creation of elegant and functional user experiences.
  • Have worked in Agile organizations in the past and participated in a Scrum or Kanban team.

Education and/or Experience:

  • At least 8 years of professional experience in software engineering preferred.
  • Recent production experience building, maintaining, and deploying client-side JavaScript applications using one or more frameworks (e.g. Vue.js, React, or Ember.js).
  • Experience with Vue.js preferred.
  • Experience in one or more languages beyond JavaScript, Java preferred.

Qualities We Care Deeply About:

  • Fun to work with.
  • Love to share and collaborate.
  • Committed to continuous improvement and learning.
  • Work ethic and desire to see things through.

Why Working With Us Is Awesome

  • People - smart, caring, and collaborative
  • Benefits - competitive salary along with 401k (w/company match), health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecommute - flexible, remote first teams
  • Impact - working on products that protect organizations and their people that are used by over half the Fortune 100
Compensation

  • Competitive salary and incentive stock options
  • 401k with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location

  • Telecommute (US Only)

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/1550/ui-lead-engineer/job?mode=view

items.title: Mobile Software Engineer @ Participate
items.content:
Mobile Software Engineer @ Participate

2017-11-14 16:48

Description

Your talents and experience as a mobile software developer will complement our team’s abilities to build a great product, www.participate.com — a platform designed to provide real-time, collaborative learning experiences for educators. You will help build innovative new features to provide our users the tools to develop their skills and collaborate with others in their field.

Participate helps teachers connect and collaborate with educators around the world to discover new resources and ideas they can incorporate into their instruction. Our collaborative professional development tools provide growth opportunities for educators that are rooted in discussion and creative, critical thinking. Participate promotes engaging learning environments, empowers teachers and inspires students to create impact on a global scale. Participate is committed to ensuring inclusive, equitable learning for all.

Our agile development team is extremely collaborative and supportive; we help each other to do our best work. As a talented and experienced software developer with experience in developing and maintaining consumer apps, you’d plug into the team and find a place to grow and learn, and help teach others so we can all continue to deliver functional and engaging software for our users.

You:

  • Collaborate well with others, and generally say "We" instead of "I"
  • Effectively review code and enjoy the process of others reviewing yours
  • Strive to improve your coding practices and those of your team
  • Proactively chip away at technical debt, and identify opportunities for infrastructural improvements
  • Feel pain when repetitive tasks aren't automated
  • Are passionate about new technologies in software development
  • Manage your time effectively, and recognize the line that denotes "good enough"
  • Are comfortable working in a remote environment
  • Passionate about empowering teachers

Technical skills:

  • 3-6 years of native mobile application development experience (Android/Kotlin preferred, Swift a plus)
  • Strong background with UI technologies and front-end development
  • Consumption of JSON and/or GraphQL APIs
  • HTML/CSS
  • Experience with React & Redux (JavaScript/ES6)

Nice to have:

  • Experience supporting the entire application lifecycle of consumer apps (concept, design, test, release and support)
  • Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market
  • Experience with React Native
  • Experience with Android Studio, Eclipse, or similar IDE
  • Interest or experience with Analytics
  • Experience with agile workflows and continuous integration/deployment

Education & Experience

  • Minimum 2-3 years of relevant professional experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent demonstrable experience

To apply, please follow the link to complete the online application. You will be asked to attach your resume to the online application and have the option of including a cover letter.

Country

United States

Location

Anywhere

items.title: GCP Architects Engineers
items.content: Impekable is actively looking for talented engineers familiar with developing and/or architecting complex solutions utilizing the diverse offerings afforded by Google Cloud Platform (GCP).  We are seeking multiple candidates experienced in planning, implementing, monitoring and servicing/maintaining robust cloud offerings.  Architect related needs are local to Irvine, CA and will require on-site collaboration.  Engineering positions are telecommute capable, but require stringent adherence to Impekable's standards for remote workers.  Currently, as opportunities require a senior level knowledge and will expect commensurate communication prowess and mature understanding of project lifecycles.  Each role has some unique aspects we're looking for, detailed below, as well as a set of general attributes relevant to all roles.

items.title: FULL STACK SOFTWARE ENGINEER / DEVELOPER
items.content:
WHY THE HIRE
We are a funded startup looking for an outstanding software engineer.

SECTOR/PRODUCT
The sector is Robotic Process Automation (RPA) - think ‘big’ robotics + ‘small’ AI. A staggering 35% of jobs are at high risk of automation over next 20 years according to a study by researchers at Oxford University and Deloitte. We will disrupt a £100b sector by developing a SaaS app that automates the efficiency and effectiveness of a specific business process. The sector will be disrupted by someone and we plan to do this first! The CEO has a proven track record in this field and a clear vision of the way forward.

STARTUP STATUS
I am a very experienced/ successful CEO founder looking for a Software Engineer to join me. The product is fully mocked-up, there is a business plan and funding is in place.

ROLE
Software Engineer/ Full Stack Developer to join this early stage startup as the first tech hire alongside the founder. Framework includes AWS, Aurora (MySQL), Python, Nginx, Vue.js express,

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE
* University degree or higher
* 2+ years professional Software Engineering Experience in relevant technology
* Job tenure [evidence that you stick with a role]
* Strong references
* Demonstrable track record
* Proven experience in web app development
* Experience in Python, SQL, Vue.js [or willing learn may be an option]

LOCATION
South UK. Work from home/ co-working hub TBA. We will set up an office in the coming months.

EQUITY
There is equity for this role as well as salary. Your outstanding talent will be rewarded - and you can dial this up by adjusting mix of salary and equity if desired…

YOU
* Outstanding at software
* Passionate about building software for a SaaS start up
* Want to generate serious wealth
* Hard working
* Dedicated and resourceful engineer
* Willing to learn technologies/ skills needed
* Authorized to work in the UK
* Happy to work from home but meet from time to time.

OPPORTUNITY
This is an amazing opportunity to join a disruptive new start-up which is funded. It will suit a developer who wants to generate significant wealth. We have a business plan as well as a full prototype mock-up. You will be able to assess the quality and viability of the venture, under NDA, once we meet.

You can work from home and getting in early means you can become part of the team and get in at ground level helping to define the culture as the company grows. Perhaps you are tired of the corporate world, boring meetings, and want the excitement and creativity of an early stage startup. Work with us if you are a brilliant developer looking for the next big thing! If you have the experience and drive to get the job done, I look forward to hearing from you. Please get in touch.

items.title: Full Stack Ruby On Rails Developer Seattle Portland Vancouver
items.content: Work with a team of smart, highly productive engineers who care greatly about the code they are shipping. Our culture is very DevOps centric with the goal of bringing the most value we can to our business through a streamlined CI/CD pipeline. Our team champions learning, bettering themselves, and teaching to the rest of the team. In addition to working with a great team and shipping a great leading SaaS product, one day every two weeks you'll invest in yourself. You can use that time to learn about new technologies, contribute to open source, or create side projects that help the company. The position is local Seattle, but will consider remote in Portland or Vancouver.

items.title: Cables & Sensors: IT Project Manager, Background in Web Development, APIs or Shopify
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere - Work will be done remotely)

Who We Are

Cables & Sensors is a highly efficient, fast-growing company that manufactures and distributes accessories for the medical industry in the US and Europe. Although being a small company, we have been awarded with the prestigious Inc 500 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America, ranking at number 377. We are a group of young, smart, perfectionists who love what we do and are proud of being very different from other companies in our industry. We are a high-tech, e-commerce company with a distributed workforce allowing us to work remotely, from our homes of where we most enjoy spending our time. Because we have built an incredibly efficient and organized business, we are very selective about who we hire. If you make it in, we promise you will love working with us.

Summary/Objective

This position will assist the IT Director with daily activities including managing web development teams for current and future projects as well as managing our API-based workflow automation running multiple web applications including Shopify. This role will be responsible for maintaining and writing software specification documents, documenting processes, managing projects and basic coding. This position requires a high level of organization, creativity and excellent communication with a wide variety of people. It also requires the ability to properly manage time and prioritize as well as making many decisions and/or know when to consult others on them. This person must have prior experience managing development projects be very comfortable with web technologies such as API connections and the Shopify platform.

Essential Functions

  1. Interacting with external development teams who are developing Cables and Sensors’ IT projects, answering questions and resolving requests

  2. Writing detailed, high-quality specification documentation for new developments

  3. Writing low to mid-level code to maintain current developments, perhaps adding new basic features that can be done in-house

  4. Exploring and identifying new tools and solutions for existing problems or improving current technology

  5. QA testing

  6. Managing timelines for various projects and keeping the teams well informed, coordinated and on schedule

Competencies

  1. Technical capacity to understand complex web developments involving APIs, front end technologies and databases.

  2. Capability to understand and write API documentation

  3. Thoroughness, the candidate must be detailed oriented and capable of following complex projects until their completion.

  4. Time management, capability to prioritize important tasks and manage large volumes of data.

  5. Communication proficiency, capability to easily communicate with remote teams by phone and email.

  6. Self-driven, motivated and capable of managing his or her own time and work.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position will supervise external, remote development teams.

Work Environment

This job is a remote position. All office and computer equipment required to perform its duties will be provided by C&S. A dedicated, quiet location with a strong internet connection at home will be required for this position.

Our team’s management style is very hands off. Each team member knows their responsibilities and has lots of freedom to do the job how they consider best. Because of this (and our remote style of working), excellent communication is very important within the team. With the high level of freedom comes an equal dose of responsibility.

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30AM to 5PM EST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. If working from a timezone different of US Eastern Standard Time, after a few months of training, independence of working hours can be achieved.

Pace of work is regularly quite high. This does not mean we expect the candidate to be overworked, but rather focused and productive during working hours. We believe that an employee produces best when they have a healthy balance of work and rest (social life, hobbies, family, free time). There will be times when deadlines are at hand and working long hours and weekends will be necessary, as there will also be slow periods when time can be taken off to compensate and take care of self.

Travel

A couple yearly trips might be required to train or work on-site with other team members.

Required Experience

Pre-requisites:

  1. 3+ years experience in development such as Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Shopify or API development

  2. 2+ years experience managing web development projects

  3. Experience with time management tools such as Trello, Bugherd, Asana, Slack, Google Docs

  4. Experience managing multiple, complex, continuous IT projects

  5. Experience writing software documentation

Nice-to-haves:

  1. Basic to medium experience developing APIs and Shopify

  2. Experience managing various IT consultants

  3. Medium to advanced experience with databases

  4. Familiarity with agile project management techniques

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Because C&S is a small, young company, it will be expected, from time to time, for every position in the company to perform tasks that are beyond their job description.

Reports to

Andres Orjuela, IT Director

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
The Company

We're a growth-stage company building a low-code business platform in the cloud.Our recently expanded management team has a track record of success with startups.Development staff work remotely. The company is headquartered near Philly.We enjoy competitive salaries, health benefits, stock options, product ownership, unlimited PTO, and more.

The Stack

Zengine's backend is a REST API, built on a LAMP stack using CakePHP.
Its frontend is a single page app, built using AngularJS.
Its "serverless" plugin architecture is powered by Node.js and AWS Lambda.
The whole stack is Docker native, and continuously delivered to AWS.

You

If you're comfortable in a fast-paced environment, value team collaboration, pride yourself on attention to detail, and are hungry to continually learn, then we want to hear from you.

  • Adherence to coding standards
  • A methodical approach to testing code
  • Knowing when, why & how to refactor
  • Familiarity with application security best practices (esp. OWASP)
  • Understanding of query & request optimization techniques (including experience with complex MySQL operations and distributed caching)
  • Proficiency with common DevOps tooling (containerization, VMs, various AWS services, Logstash + Kibana, etc)

items.title: Contract: Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer at FullStack in Anywhere
items.content:
FullStack is looking for an experienced, passionate, and talented Ruby on Rails developer who can jump in and take ownership of challenging application development and design and architecture problems.Since this is the web, you’ll need be experienced with the usual suspects: JavaScript, CSS, HTML, SQL databases, KV stores, background job processing, etc. Most new projects are built using Ruby on Rails, but it would be great if you have a broad range of web development experience beyond Rails.

We are a distributed team with folks all across the United States, so this is a remote position and we’re looking for contractors with the potential to transition to full-time.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Development of Ruby on Rails applications (Rails 4.x and 5.x)
  • Leading in developing and improving all aspects of our applications (development, testing, deployment, architecture)
  • Architect scalable and performant web applications and APIs
  • Writing well tested, maintainable code.
  • Creation of technical documentation for APIs and component designs
  • Maintain the deployment pipeline and processes for our applications.
  • Providing technical support of applications (fixing bugs and supporting clients' needs).

About FullStack

Our mission is to make our clients incredibly successful by developing and improving ideas into highly functional and usable web applications. Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our development work focuses on architecting and building new applications as well as scaling existing apps for our clients as they grow.

We’re looking for you if you…

  • Have developed libraries, applications, or web sites and want to show them to us (you have code on GitHub, BitBucket, etc.)
  • Have an extensive knowledge of the resources available through Ruby gems and open source libraries.
  • Enjoy working with Rails and have a successful track record of developing applications using it
  • Are equally comfortable with SQL or an ORM and have exposure to a variety of database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB)
  • Have an appreciation for the peace of mind that comes with well-tested, documented code
  • Have exceptional knowledge and experience front-end web technologies (JavaScript, CSS, HTML, etc.)
  • Have experience making decisions regarding application architecture
  • Are excited by the web and keep up with new technologies and that excitement is infectious
  • Communicate well with others in both written and verbal forms
  • Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively
  • Are able to excel in highly collaborative environment with team based activities including code review and pair programming

Bonus points for…

  • Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
  • Having developed on iOS, especially if you have contributed to an app in the App Store
  • Experience working with Javascript MVC frameworks, such as React or AngularJS
  • Working understanding of developing front-end solutions in vanilla javascript
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science, Math or other interesting analytic discipline
  • Development skills with other languages, like PHP or Scala
  • Being comfortable with PaaS hosts like Heroku
  • Familiarity with using Docker in a development environment
  • Experience working with the ActiveAdmin gem
  • Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team
  • Significant contributions to or ownership of open source projects (please do tell!)

Other information about this position

  • Working remotely is how we operate
  • This is a contract position with the possibility of 40+ hours per week.
  • Work visa transfer or sponsorship is not possible at this time
  • We are looking for people located within one of the U.S time zones

items.title: Clevertech: Tech Lead
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

- 75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical strategy;

- 25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients. You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated successful product launches.

___

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities.

 

 

 

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Apply:

items.title: UI/UX Designer
items.content:
UI/UX Designer at Solna.io
 
Solna was founded with a mission: to empower a generation of entrepreneurs and small businesses to
turn passion into profit. Solna is funded by a group of serial entrepreneurs that has stakes in multiple
successful fin-tech startups across Europe.
Solna.io is looking for a talented, driven UI/UX Designer for a role based in central London, developing
the evolving visual style of an exciting new FinTech startup, which aims to radically improve how Small
Business get paid. 

Let’s talk if you:
- An eye for typography, illustrations and cutting-edge design
- Have a passion for solving complex problems and love bringing fresh ideas to an age-old
problem.
As an experienced UI/UX designer, our expectation is that you’ll perform the following functions…  
 
Key Responsibilities:
- High understanding of business KPIs - and a history of achieving them using creative solutions
(please show us examples)
- Create elegant experiences: That delight our future customers and deliver on business
outcomes and extremely well thought through UX principles
- Work with the team to implement new visual styles across the web, social media, email
templates, marketing and mobile
- Startup experience: Understand that you're going to be working across different disciplines
and may be involved into multiple projects in an iterative format
- Execution of designs: From the initial concept, understanding the briefs and collaborating with
the rest of the team to create beautiful UI
- User testing:  Assist the design process by organising and participating in continuous user
testing, research and usability studies

Qualifications:
- Exceptional creative skills across multiple platforms
- Great visual/illustration skills
- Organised, self-directed, efficient and able to manage multiple and complex projects in a
timely manner
- Strong presentation skills and stakeholder management
- Comfortable working with remote teams
- Expert-level proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Prototyping tools
- A strong online portfolio (please provide link) and an evidence-based design approach
- Animation skills desirable but not essential

No agencies or recruiters, please.

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer @ Fieldboom
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer @ Fieldboom

2017-11-13 03:31

Description

A Bit About Us

  • First and foremost, we are advocates of small business owners - we know their struggles, we empathize with them and we want to help them grow their businesses
  • We’re building beautifully simple SaaS software to help them collect and analyze feedback that will help them grow their business using data, not guess work
  • We’re a remote team full of razor-sharp engineers, designers, content creators and marketers who love to learn and seek to continually get better
  • Our founder has a product/engineering/marketing background and has launched multiple companies which have generated 9-figures in combined revenue

A Bit About You (As A Person)

  • You are a learning machine - and rarely let a day go by where you don’t learn something
  • You know, like and agree with most of the views shared by the Basecamp guys
  • You value honesty, integrity and hard work immensely
  • You have hobbies outside of work and work doesn’t define you as a person
  • You want to join a team full of smart, creative people you will learn from
  • You’re looking for a career, not just another job

A Bit About You (Tech)

  • You have 2+ years of solid front-end dev experience working on large SPAs
  • You work well with back-end developers and have a good understanding of (and respect for) the relationship between product managers and engineers
  • You’ve been part of a remote team before or you’ve freelanced for at least 2 years

In terms of languages, frameworks, etc, here’s what we’re using right now - and what you’ll need excellent familiarity with to be a great fit for this role:

  • React
  • React DnD
  • Redux
  • Immutable.js
  • SCSS
  • Jest
  • Docker

What You’ll Do

  • Build out the front-end components that we’ll re-use as we’re building the product
  • Work closely with our other engineers to build new features that will help our customers collect, analyze and use feedback to grow their businesses
  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise
  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs
  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity
  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything
  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

Country

Anywhere*

Location

4 hour overlap with U.S. west coast required

items.title: Sticker Mule: Sr. fullstack engineer
items.content:
Sr. fullstack engineer

Posted Nov 10

Sticker Mule
Headquarters: New York, NY
https://www.stickermule.com/blog

Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable and powered by an outstanding remote team that supports the growth of our manufacturing operations. We aim to build one of the Internet’s best technical teams. Currently, our development team operates in 8 countries and we’re always looking for more exceptional developers to join us. 

Why we enjoy working here 
1. We work flexible hours with an asynchronous culture. 
2. We work at a sustainable pace without unreasonable external deadlines. 
3. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on. 
4. Opportunities to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team. 

What you will do 
1. Design, build, test, deploy and maintain web applications and services. 
2. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team's code style guidelines. 
3. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all of our software. 
4. Collaborate with team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we're always building the best possible solution in the optimal way. 
5. Participate in peer code reviews. 
6. Share expertise with other members of the team and mentor junior developers. 

Requirements 
1. 3+ years of professional software development experience. 
2. High competency in at least one of the following languages: JavaScript, Ruby, or Go. 
3. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. 
4. Strong written and verbal communication skills in English. 
5. Experience with microservices/SOA or DevOps would be beneficial. 

Application requirements 
1. Applicants will be sent a Hackerrank test within 1-3 days of applying. 
2. Test must be completed within 5 days. 

Apply for this position

Apply here only: https://www.stickermule.com/jobs?job=178e2cdf-2e15-47e8-9d32-b24ac89032bf&title=sr-fullstack-engineer

Requirements

Apply for this position

3. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on.
4. Opportunities to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.

What we look for
https://www.stickermule.com/blog/characteristics-we-look-for-in-team-members

What you'll do
1. Build, test, install and maintain software to automate our manufacturing processes.
2. Continually seek ways to optimize those processes.
3. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team’s code style guidelines.
4. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all our software.
5. Collaborate with other developers, team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we’re always building the optimal solution.
6. Participate in peer code reviews.
7. Share expertise with other members of the team, mentor junior developers.
8. Spend some time on-site at our factory to learn about software requirements and maintain existing software.

About you
1. You have a minimum of 3 years professional software development experience.
2. You’re highly competent in multiple general purpose languages. C++ and Ruby would be especially beneficial.
3. You’re confident in mathematics relevant to computer graphics.
4. Experience with the following would be highly beneficial.
5. Printing and related issues like color management.
6. Vector and raster graphics generation and manipulation.
7. You are experienced in using and building web services.
8. You possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
9. You have great written and verbal communication skills in English.

Requirements
1. This position requires regular visits to our manufacturing facilities in upstate NY.
2. Applicants will be sent a Hackerrank test within 1-2 business days of applying.
3. Test must be completed within 5 business days.

items.title: Ruby On Rails Developer
items.content:
Ruby on Rails Developer


Orlando, Florida, United States


Opportunity:


We are looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails developer to join our core team. You’ll be a part of our small but exceptional team working for an exciting company with significant growth potential.


Qualifications:



  • Ruby on Rails, MySQL, Git, JavaScript, HTML, CSS

  • Experience with connecting and pulling data from Google and Facebook APIs

  • At least 2 years professional software development experience

  • Must be self-starting and able to multitask and function efficiently in a fast-paced agency environment

  • Creativity, an open mind and good communication skills

  • Ability to work at our downtown Orlando office location minimum 2 days per week


Responsibilities:



  • Design, develop and deploy Ruby on Rails web applications in an agile development environment

  • Integrate with Google Analytics API, Google AdWords API, Facebook Marketing API, and other third-party data services

  • Collaborate with account managers and fellow team members to establish and refine requirements

  • Work throughout a full stack from the database to Rails, Git, Javascript, and HTML/CSS, etc


Job Perks:



  • Remote working

  • Flexible work schedule

  • Health care benefits

  • Laid back company culture

items.title: ReactJS Front End Tech Lead
items.content: We're looking to hire a senior front end developer, with experience of, or interest in ReactJS to work mostly on new projects here in Cardiff. We're a fast growing tech startup, with a great work life balance and a real interest in helping you develop your career. We're open to remote and flexible working (perhaps you'd like to do 4 days a week, or you need to be away for nursery pickup at 3.30).

items.title: Fieldboom: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer

Posted Nov 10

Fieldboom
Headquarters: Sydney
http://www.fieldboom.com

A Bit About Us

  • First and foremost, we are advocates of small business owners - we know their struggles, we empathize with them and we want to help them grow their businesses

  • We’re building beautifully simple SaaS software to help them collect and analyze feedback that will help them grow their business using data, not guess work

  • We’re a remote team full of razor-sharp engineers, designers, content creators and marketers who love to learn and seek to continually get better

  • Our founder has a product/engineering/marketing background and has launched multiple companies which have generated 9-figures in combined revenue

A Bit About You (As A Person)

  • You are a learning machine - and rarely let a day go by where you don’t learn something

  • You know, like and agree with most of the views shared by the Basecamp guys
  • You value honesty, integrity and hard work immensely

  • You have hobbies outside of work and work doesn’t define you as a person

  • You want to join a team full of smart, creative people you will learn from

  • You’re looking for a career, not just another job

A Bit About You (Tech)

  • You have 2+ years of solid front-end dev experience working on large SPAs

  • You work well with back-end developers and have a good understanding of (and respect for) the relationship between product managers and engineers

  • You’ve been part of a remote team before or you’ve freelanced for at least 2 years

In terms of languages, frameworks, etc, here’s what we’re using right now - and what you’ll need excellent familiarity with to be a great fit for this role:

  • React

  • React DnD

  • Redux

  • Immutable.js

  • SCSS

  • Jest

  • Docker

What You’ll Do

  • Build out the front-end components that we’ll re-use as we’re building the product

  • Work closely with our other engineers to build new features that will help our customers collect, analyze and use feedback to grow their businesses

  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise

  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs

  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity

  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything

  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

Please note: this is a full-time equivalent contract role for 40 hours per week.

Apply for this position

Please email the following to work@fieldboom.com: an overview of a front-end project you’ve worked on using React that you were the most proud of (what, specifically, did you do, who was in your team and what did you learn), a link to anywhere we can learn more about you (blog, web site, LinkedIn, Github, etc), a link to any live SaaS apps, etc that you've worked on as a frontend developer, the name of the best book you read in 2017 and why (can be non work-related).

items.title: Senior Python Software Engineer
items.content: Want to work remotely as a full time developer for a company that has been writing software for 35 years but is also using the latest technologies? We are currently looking to add a remote back end web developer to our team rewriting our existing software products from scratch. You will work on the team which is responsible for developing the entire application stack. You will need to collaborate with other team members to solve problems and design systems that meet the specified requirements.

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
*We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.*

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

_Essential_
* Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience
* Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies
* A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.
* Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum
* Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation
* Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment

_Desirable_
* Web application user interface design skills and experience
* Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services
* An understanding of application security and secure coding practices
* Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery
* Work as an integral member of a small and remote team
* Agree and deliver on sprint commitments
* Design and implement secure software components
* Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases
* Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality
* Participate in peer review processes
* Supporting the team through the full release cycle
* Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations
* Supporting the test team where automation is necessary
* To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

items.title: Packlane: Software Engineer
items.content:
Software Engineer

Posted Nov 9

Packlane
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
https://packlane.com

At Packlane, we help customers create impactful custom packaging – and we need you to create the powerful code that makes it all possible. In fact, we’d be OK with you wearing a brightly colored cape at your desk because you have X-ray vision for detecting bugs and a utility belt full of tools to eradicate them. As the ideal candidate, you understand that inventive and stable software is essential to the continued prosperity of our business — and also result in web experiences more forceful than a locomotive.

Consider Packlane a unique challenge - you’ll be in charge of code that allows people with a range of design knowledge (from novice to expert craftsman) to create a product that truly helps them tell their business’s brand story. It’s a big job, but the generalist engineer we’re looking for will be excited to work on a career-defining start-up that’s pioneering a new approach to designing and manufacturing packaging. Join our team as a software engineer and put your super-skills to work for good.

What You'll Do:
  • Ideate. Create. Innovate. Help our small (but ultra-productive!) team build new and wonderful products.
  • Craft the front end and back end of our web applications.
  • Build reliable systems in Elixir and Phoenix.
  • Design fabulous user experience with modern JavaScript standards (ECMAScript 2015 via Babel) and scale the front end with React.js and Redux.
  • Utilize unit testing in Elixir and Javascript with continuous integration to keep the bugs out.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, department heads and consultants to provide the best user experience possible. 
  • Bend steel with your bare hands (optional).

What You'll Love About Packlane:
  • A chance to try new technologies - Packlane is an opportunity to cut your teeth on a novel technology stack, including innovative development frameworks and cutting-edge functional languages.
  • Support Modern Browsers - We’re living in the future and build for modern versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari and IE. No IE8 here.  
  • We’re a small team - You’ll be one of few, which means you’ll have a real chance to make an impact. Expect (and hopefully enjoy!) a lot of control and influence over product decisions and prioritization.
  • You’ll help build our future - We’ve got a lot of ambitious projects in the works, from building manufacturing infrastructure from the ground up, to implementing robust order management systems that orchestrate an intricate production flow, and you’ll be at the forefront of it all.  
  • Flexibility - We’re an international team who appreciates the freedom to work remotely/from home when we need to, and we value getting everyone together in-person for the occasional company retreat. 

Requirements:
  • Mid level experience with Javascript and Elixir. You’ve built big projects in production and used both languages in anger. 
  • You’re excited by TDD and also know when perfectionism is the enemy of delivered.
  • An easy-to-work-with attitude, well-organized and highly self-motivated.
  • Reliable. Accountable. Dependable. And all the other good -ables. You know what they are.
  • Great communication and collaboration skills.
  • Strong work ethic and a healthy obsession with learning new things.
  • Familiarity with Git, NPM/Yarn, and AWS.

Bonus Points:
  • Pragmatic approaches to complex problems.
  • Capability and interest in championing best practices in React.js.
  • Functional programming advocates: who value immutability and functional purity.
  • Previous experience on remote teams.

Apply for this position

Apply @ https://packlane.workable.com/jobs/604507

items.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Go/Javascript/HTML/CSS)
items.content:
*Full Stack Software Engineer (Go/Javascript/HTML/CSS)*

To us, being a Full Stack engineer is a mindset, you need to be competent in your core skills and excited to learn and try new things as and when you see a fit or need. No one wants to spread themselves too thinly and that is why we have carefully selected our few core technologies but we are not afraid of trying anything new that may be right for the job. If you agree with this then read on, it should hopefully mean that you are someone that likes to self improve.
This role is to be the first tech hire alongside Nub’s founder. You will be a key hire and valued highly if you can work hard as a team towards the aims of the company. Your judgement will be valued as we work towards engineering a unique multi-platform application with a web app based UI and a Go based back end.

*About you:*
- You are a dedicated and resourceful engineer
- 2+ years of professional Full Stack Software Engineering Experience
- Proven experience of completing HTML/CSS/Javascript deliverables (web app development not brochure style websites)
- Competence in Go (Golang) but if you have experience delivering software with another language (such as Python) and are keen to learn Go that may work.
- Competence writing SQL
- Happy to work with Node.js, Electron, ES6, Babel, Webpack.
- Exposure to Vuejs or similar (e.g. react)
- You love staying on top of the latest developments in software development
- Must be authorized to work in the UK
- Happy to work from home but meet in London for regular meetings.

*About Nub:*
Lego for written comms. Modular utility, ubiquity and unique accessibility.

Nub makes sending beautiful and personalised emails, invoices, forms, itineraries, receipts etc as easy as building with lego. Comprised of an engine and codeless tools to automate data capture, data manipulation and subsequent output primarily via email, pdf, print, data, or api. Triggered by any system, language or data and achieved without the need to be a programmer.

This kit will mean everyone can create cool customer communications on a new, automated, intuitive and scalable platform. It will allow anyone to handle data transformation and create automated output such as print, pdf or email. Have control over branding, designs customisation and personalisation.

Developers will love this because it removes a complex distraction from their applications. Companies large and small will love this because it will allow custom communications from any system to their employees or clients.
Anyone looking to automate data transformation from one format to the other will love this because they will find it a breeze to achieve.

*Why work for us?*
Nub is a new startup, the plan is to grow and become something every developer wants to use and every company choses to use... The CEO has a proven track record in this field and a forensic knowledge of the current technology and a clear vision of its potential.

You’ll get to work from home and help define our culture as the company grows. The plan is for a London office when the time is right. The CEO has a family, likes coffee, tech, would love a dog, used to race cars and loves sport.

You may want to exit the corporate world and enter into an exciting journey with an early stage startup. You may be bored of coding to someone else's spec, getting stuck in meetings and not being able to be creative with your code. Work at Nub and that will change.
Perhaps you are a brilliant coder looking for a great idea – this is it!

items.title: Sched: Lead Android Engineer to Build Event Apps
items.content:
Lead Android Engineer to Build Event Apps

Posted Nov 9

Sched
Headquarters: Planet Earth
https://sched.com/jobs-android

WHAT WE DO
Events are where we go to be inspired by those who've followed their dreams, learn from the people who want us to succeed, build life-long friendships and discover new opportunities.

Our goal is to help organizers succeed in building more of these unforgettable events. Thousands of events depend on Sched, like tech conferences, comic conventions, music festivals, yoga festivals, professional development days and even furry conventions. Seriously, there is an event for everything.

You'll be building something that makes a real difference to our customers. Here's actual feedback about what you'll be building:

I wonder what the world did before Sched...
  • Sched completely revolutionized our convention.
  • Sched is pretty fuckin' awesome.
  • Using Sched is something I actively LOOK FORWARD TO whenever we're getting ready to put on another event.

YOU ARE
  • Driven to work on something that has thousands of passionate customers — and make it even better.
  • Excited to take a critical role in building out better processes for getting things done at Sched.
  • Outstanding with communication skills and the ability to keep your team in the loop.
  • Self-motivated to take on responsibilities and meet deadlines.
  • Ready to work with a small team that has your back and will support your growth.

YOUR EXPERIENCE
  • 2+ years experience developing and maintaining Android apps. (Kotlin/Java)
  • Deep understanding of Android fundamentals (concurrency, networking, SQLite) and interface guidelines.
  • Discipline to write clean and well-documented code w/ unit testing and CI process.
  • Experience w/ integrating RESTful web services and push notifications.
  • Experience w/ code versioning tools like Git.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
You'll be building our brand new attendee-facing app. This is your chance to start fresh with no legacy code base and create something that you are proud of -- that's clean and well-documented. It will be used by millions of attendees.

LOCATION
As part of Sched's remote-only team, you can work from anywhere in the world. Some of our team use the flexibility to work from home. Some of our team use it to travel. It's up to you. Our founder has lived in Airbnbs for the past 5 years.

We get together throughout the year in incredible places like Bali, Tokyo, Berlin and Mykonos, all covered by Sched. Part work, part vacation, we call them #schedcations. Want to join us?

PAY & BENEFITS
Salary is dependent on experience. Generous benefits include paying you to take vacation, conferences stipends, equipment when needed and flexible hours.

Apply for this position

Email jobs@sched.com with the subject line "I want to join Sched" and tell us:1) A bit about yourself & why you're a great fit for our team.2) Live examples of apps you've built and what you were responsible for.3) Links to Github or social media or a personal site that helps us get to know you.4) Ask us one question about Sched.

items.title: Java Software Engineer - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Java Software Engineer
Crossover -Remote
$30,000 a year - Contract
Ready to make $30,000 USD while working for a fortune 500 company from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market and collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Engineers from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.

Job Description:

Choose Crossover and you’ll be joining our team of world class developers to handle applications as they move across tech stacks. Our team consistently creates new build processes and tackles any bugs that arise in scripts and code. Crossover’s brilliant engineers focus on solving difficult and complex technical issues, not simple bugs fixed with a quick online search. You’ll be challenged, and your technical skills will be sharpened. We are looking for new developers eager to build on their years of technical experience to contribute to our culture of cutting edge excellence.

Total compensation: $30,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

Required Education and Experience:

If you want to work with the best, you have to be the best. A successful Java Engineer at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:
  • A ruthless commitment to testing the code you’ve written

  • Extensive problem solving skills

  • An ability to communicate clearly regarding complex issues (in English)

  • Proficiency in the following technologies and skills is mandatory:

    • Java EE (Web Services, REST, JPA)

    • Databases (SQL server, Oracle, MySQL)

    • JUnit

    • JavaScript, HTML, XML, APIs, and JSP

    • ANT, Eclipse, and Subversion SVN

    • Linux (from the command line via SSH)

  • What to set yourself apart? Proficiency in the following technologies will make you an especially attractive candidate: Spring, NHibernate, Design patterns, noSQL

The Type of Java Engineers We’re Looking For:

Crossover values a culture of excellence. We need engineers who are not only technically proficient, but also demonstrate the following qualities:
  • A willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • A Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problem you’re facing

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stopping until it’s done correctly

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

However, it is important to note that while you will work as a "contractor," these are long-term contracts that should be your only source of employment. You are not permitted to work additional jobs on the side. Please do not apply unless you are available to make this position your sole employment.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Engineers from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.To begin, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. Then, create your applicant account and come back on Saturday to complete your testing. There will be a series of online examinations and a final interview. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Engineers from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.To begin, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. Then, create your applicant account and come back on Saturday to complete your testing. There will be a series of online examinations and a final interview. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Android Chief Software Architect - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Android Chief Software Architect
Crossover -Remote
$100,000 a year
Android Chief Software Architect - $50/hr

Do you have extensive experience building high traffic and large scale enterprise android apps?Are you ready to hit the ground running in a dynamic leadership role within our fast-paced environment? Do you get excited at the idea of building the future of innovation, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers, and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources?Are you eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world while earning $100,000 USD, all from the comfort of your home?If so, this role is for you.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Chief Architects from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.

Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor based model does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams. Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

At Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.

Job Description:Join Crossover and you’ll be part of a team responsible for designing, coding, testing, debugging and maintaining various digital media applications. We strive to keep current on the latest trends in mobile technologies, so you’ll be expected to effectively lead team members and act as a technical reference.

You will explain various technologies and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will develop and support front-end, online mobile product initiatives.

You will be responsible for creating and iterating excellent software applications with top quality user experience.

On a bigger scale, you will work together with other developers, engineers, and production groups to design and implement new applications, systems, and tools that are unparalleled in the market.

Responsibilities:
  • Software Development – Design and Implement new features based on customer requirements having end-to-end responsibility for delivery and quality. Drive root cause analysis of bugs and implement their fixes.

  • Requirement Analysis – Document, analyze and estimate requirements based on customer needs.

  • Process and Methodology – Work in an Agile environment and use tools such as Git, JIRA and Confluence to track development and issues related to a product.

  • Communication – Perform a key role in conference calls with global team members.

Required Skills:If you want to work with the best, you have to be the best. A successful Android Chief Architect at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience building high traffic and large scale Enterprise Android apps

  • 4 years of experience as a React.js developer

  • Committed to producing code that follows the best practice’s of the industry

  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:

    • Java 8

    • Android Studio

    • OO programming and design patterns

    • REST API consumption

    • HTML5, JavaScript

    • WebServices and consume APIs

    • Unit testing and mobile test automation frameworks

    • Continuous integration and delivery of mobile applications

    • NoSQL and relational databases

Bonus Skills:
  • Proficiency in iOS SDK is desired but not mandatory

  • User Experience Design and Information Architecture

  • Maps (Google, ArcGis)

  • Cloud

This role may be a great fit if you have:
  • An ability to quickly and eagerly learn new technologies

  • A Willingness to take responsibility for projects and determine their trajectory

  • An ability to consistently meet deadlines even while running multiple projects

  • Excellent communication skills with a wide range of individuals (in English)

  • A collaborative approach to team projects

Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location:Global (remote)

Hours:40 productive hours per week

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Chief Architects from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.To begin, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. Then, create your applicant account and come back on Saturday to complete your testing. There will be a series of online examinations and a final interview. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

Are you up for the challenge?

items.title: Senior Node.js / React Developer
items.content:
ManageFlitter – http://ManageFlitter.com – is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

Our new product http://ManageSocial.com is well into development (we are very close to private alpha release). You can get a sneak peak of a very early version of ManageSocial here -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W2oABEOCdpo&featur... 

This is a unique opportunity to work on an interesting greenfield project. Initially you will be working with 1 mid-weight engineer , 1 UI designer, and a tech lead to take this product from alpha to launch and beyond. You will also be working directly with the CEO.

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney with team members in Canada, Brazil, Ukraine & Russia. We are approximately 50% remote based.

We believe Social Media is changing the world and we love being part of the change.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team to work with us on our new ManageSocial product.

Whilst this is a remote friendly role our headquarters are based in Sydney Australia - time crossover is required with the team in Sydney and team members in other parts of the world. Depending on your location this may require you to time shift to some degree. 

Team is everything and we are proud of the great ManageFlitter and ManageSocial team that we have built. To ensure that the team remains of a very high standard we follow a fairly rigorous hiring process:

  • Initial 10-20 minute Skype chat.
  • Technical task: a custom designed technical task that allows us to gain insight into your approach to solving technical problems: 2-4 hours for someone familiar with our stack.
  • Technical interview: in depth technical chat based on your technical task: 1-2 hours.
  • Skype chat with 1-2 additional team members - 1 hour.


  • Impeccable English communication skills.
  • 5+ years experience building APIs preferably with Node.js, Express.js / Koa.js or similar.
  • Strong literacy with ES6 features and stay up to date with standards using babel.
  • Experience working with TDD including writing unit, integration & functional tests.
  • Experience working with BDD.
  • Experience delivering responsive UX/UI.
  • Understands Websockets and using Redis pub/sub model for real time communication with clients.
  • Previously worked on development of products using a SQL storage backend.
  • Experience building SPAs using React.
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services including Lambda.
  • Experience working with Postgres at scale.
  • Has built an application implementing the following:
    Redux
    Redux Sagas
    Reselect
    React Router
    ImmutableJS
    PostCSS
  • Experience working in an agile environment with a working knowledge of scrum and kanban workflows.
  • Relevant tertiary education.



BONUS SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Product flair.
  • Strong working knowledge of the Twitter and Instagram API.
  • Experience writing technical specifications and documentation.
  • Has contributed to open source projects (provide examples if available).
  • Experience leading technical teams.
Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

We are committed to creating a culture where every team member can do their best work.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

To apply: Please apply at the following url:https://manageflitter.workable.com/jobs/544542

items.title: Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation
items.content:
Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation

2017-11-09 00:24

Description

About Us

Appnovation, a global technology enabled services provider, specializes in the design, development and integration of enterprise-grade open technology solutions. With 10 offices and 200+ employees, Appnovation delivers to clients ranging from startups to the Fortune 500, government entities and nonprofit organizations, helping them to identify opportunities for innovation and stay competitive.

To learn more about Appnovation’s projects, awards, or culture visit www.appnovation.com.

We are seeking an Ionic/Angular JS (experience with Angular 4 preferred) developer to deliver complex apps in Ionic and on our client's platforms. Alongside project delivery, you will maintain internal reference app that demonstrates the best of Ionic and its value proposition.

This role can be done remotely.

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO

  • Work on a number of hybrid mobile applications backed by an in-house component library to rapidly develop and deliver solutions
  • Work closely with product teams during the implementation of the mobile app
  • Work in a tight feedback loop with the product owners
  • Take requirements and make reusable / configurable components that can be used in component library.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Excellent written and verbal English
  • Confident when working with Product Owners and understanding their objectives
  • Proactive work chaser - not a “specification waiter”
  • Good experience working with remote teams
  • Experience working independently in an iterative delivery environments
  • Have an expectations setting mindset and be highly communicative
  • Be able to onboard quickly and work within team disciplines and constraints

Technical Skills required

  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular JS development experience
  • Native or other hybrid mobile app development experience (Cordova/PhoneGap)
  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular development experience using various flavours of JavaScript, specifically TypeScript, ES6 and ES2015
  • Excellent experience with REST APIs, JSON, NoSQL + data modelling
  • Excellent experience analyzing business and technical requirements
  • Automated testing framework experience
  • Mule/Cloudhub experience is a bonus
  • Experience with Janrain is a bonus

Thank you for your interest in a career with Appnovation Technologies!

Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Appnovation Technologies is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are treated equally.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype
items.content:
Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype

2017-11-09 00:10

Description

Sonatype’s mission is to enable organizations to better manage their software supply chain. We offer a series of products and services including the Nexus Repository Manager and Nexus Lifecycle Manager.

We are a remote and talented product development group and we work in small autonomous teams to create high quality products. Thousands of organizations and millions of developers use our software. If you have a passion for challenging problems, software craftsmanship, and having impact, then Sonatype is the right place for you.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Strong software engineering foundation and experience.
  • Strong development experience with the Java stack.
  • Experience building dynamic JavaScript-based web applications.
  • Experience working in an environment leveraging remote communication and collaboration tools (e.g. HipChat, Slack, video conferencing, wikis, Github, etc).
  • Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

Desired Experience & Skills

  • Experience or knowledge of other programming languages and ecosystems is a major plus as it is relevant to the domain of our products and services (Java, Maven, C/C++, Ruby, Python, PyPI, Node.js, npm, .NET, NuGet, etc.).
  • Knowledge and experience of continuous delivery, including automated testing of various layers, containerization, automation of infrastructure provisioning and deployment, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience of relational and non-relational databases.
  • Experience developing applications deployed in Amazon Web Services.
  • Experience in an Agile development environment.
  • Experience working in a remote environment.

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We are proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 120,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We are curious and constantly innovating without fear of failure. We are attacking a huge and emerging market and seeking remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

Sonatype is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.
