items.title: Unhaggle Inc.: Full Stack Engineer (Strong Python) - Build the smartest way to buy a car
items.content:
Full Stack Engineer (Strong Python) - Build the smartest way to buy a car

Posted Oct 27

Unhaggle Inc.
Headquarters: Toronto, Canada
https://www.unhaggle.com

Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.

We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer with experience in Python and web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world.

We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio and Redis. Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.

You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas:

* Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brands
* Our web portal unhaggle.com
* Several enterprise SaaS products, some more info here https://www.motoinsight.com
* REST APIs, for integration with different partners
* An internal and innovative SaaS web application we built for industry clients
* Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.
* Maintenance of our test suite and code base
* Implementation of new features
* We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following standards such as PEP-8 and good software engineering practices.

Requirements:

* Strong hands on experience with Python, experience with Django is important, but we might still be willing to consider candidates with strong Python skills and none or little knowledge with Django.
* Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascript well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks is a big plus
* Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based
* Good SQL knowledge and databases, PostgreSQL is a plus
* You should be very familiar with Linux
* Experience using version control software, Git is a plus
* Understanding of code best practices and standards. We also expect that you follow PEP-8 style guide and use tools like Pyflakes and Pylint very often
* Experience writing Python test cases is a plus. Prior experience with TDD and/or Selenium is a plus.
* Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review
* This position might grow into a technical lead position. Experience leading development teams is a plus

We are helping consumers to get the best price on new cars in Canada and changing the industry along the way. Working at Unhaggle brings unique challenges, you will have the opportunity to leave a large footprint and have real impact in the product we ship every day to our customers.

No relocation available, we are a distributed team.

Apply for this position

Please submit resume and cover letter to emiquelito@motoinsight.com

items.title: PhishMe: Security Production Engineer
items.content:
Security Production Engineer

Posted Oct 26

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg
phishme.com/company/careers

PhishMe is seeking a mid to senior level Security Production Engineer.  As a Security Production Engineer, you will play a critical role in effectively building, maintaining and improving the security of our systems, platform, and infrastructure deployed in AWS and in On Premise security appliances.  You will be responsible for the development and deployment of tools and processes that for securely managing environments used by PhishMe Simulator, Triage, and other SaaS and Managed Service offerings.  You will also work with other security-focused engineers, production engineers, and software engineers to manage traditional systems and network security tools such as web application firewalls, DDoS service, HIDS while working to integrate security into dynamic cloud environments that leverage AWS services and Docker.

You will have the opportunity to influence and design current strategies and procedures for securing our environments.  You will directly influence the application configuration, deployment process of our application and create tools to improve our processes, monitoring and application infrastructure to implement a SecDevOps approach that is integrated into the deployment pipelines, continuous, and low-friction where security cannot be a blocker. 

 
This role will report to a Director of Production Engineering or the Vice President Production Engineering.  

 This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc. Outsourced or software development contractors will not be considered.

 Responsibilities:

  • Work across multiple production engineering and development teams to establish, enforce, and socialize security practices and procedures in the building of environments and deployment of code
  • Implement, configure, and manage of security tooling for hosts and applications and cloud services
  • Perform vulnerability identification and remediation including patch management for systems and networks
  • Objectively assess risks based on business critical of system and data assets
  • Manage and monitor AWS account security including best practices, security groups, user access
  • Manage and configure of security tooling such as web application firewall, HIDS, VPNs. 
  • Manage of user access, roles, and permissions to critical services
  • Harden systems and cloud infrastructure according to industry best practices such as CIS
  • Implement security controls to address compliance requirements such as SOC2, ISO, HIPPA, and GDPR.
  • Cross-team work with the various product offerings within PhishMe
  • Provide support to Sales Engineering in developing responses to RFP/RFQs

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • Solid knowledge of Enterprise security fundamentals and how they must to be adapted DevOps/Cloud Environments
  • Ability to analyze security event and vulnerability findings from disparate sources (network, application, operating system, etc.) using a variety of manual and automated tools and processes
  • Comfortable with a fast-moving development pace where security cannot be a blocker
  • Knowledge of AWS Cloud Infrastructure (EC2, VPC, ELB, RDS) and security technology (security groups, CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs, CloudWatch)
  • Familiarity with automated configuration management such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible
  • Strong Linux (CentOS/Ubuntu) background with experience working in large AWS deployments
  • A strong interest in the field of information security principles

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Past experience working as part of distributed, remote-first team.
  • Docker CLI familiarity and knowledge of repositories and container management
  • Experience managing and building virtual appliances.
  • Python or Ruby development background.
  • Experience automating tasks in AWS using CloudFormation or Terraform
  • Experience automating AWS tasks with Lambda Functions
  • Experience Non-AWS Cloud providers such Azure or GCE
  • Familiarity with Jenkins, Git, Artifactory
  • Experience with Signal Sciences, JumpCloud, Jenkins, OSSEC HIDS and Zscaler

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary and incentive stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location

  • Full-time Telecommute (The United States only)
 

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below: https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/1415/security-production-engineer/job

items.title: TallyGo: Senior iOS Developer (who plays the theremin)
items.content:
Senior iOS Developer (who plays the theremin)

Posted Oct 26

TallyGo
Headquarters: Los Angeles
http://www.tallygo.com

Ever been stuck in traffic and thought to yourself, "This totally blows." And then you thought, "Now I'm so cranky I'm gonna need to play my theremin to calm down." Well, now you have a chance to help theremin players everywhere free themselves from all this GD traffic gridlock.

As a Senior iOS Developer at TallyGo, you will be part of a small, distributed team of scientists and engineers working on the cutting edge of navigation, route planning, and transportation science. Your job will be to help build out the SDK and apps that brings our vision to life. We are creating robust services that leverage sophisticated graph algorithms so that consumers and businesses can steer clear of traffic, save time and money, and reduce congestion on our roads. Bottom line: We're here to save people's sanity and put them back in control.

Note: This job requires that you play the theremin in our polka metal band called "Peekaboo Slugfest". (Not really, but wouldn't that be awesome!)

Must Have Skills
  • iOS developer with 5+ years experience
  • Published at least one iOS app
  • Published at least one iOS framework
  • Experience with Swift
  • Experience working with remote teams
  • Excellent English communication skills

Nice to Have Skills
  • Experience with mapping, navigation, and/or search APIs

Skills You Don't Need
  • Operate an industrial meat slicer, touch your elbow with your tongue, skip a stone on a pond

Our Values
  • Humble and open minded
  • Transparent and honest
  • Self directed and dependable
  • Positive and friendly
  • Sense of humor
  • No ego, no assholes

Working With Us
  • We have an office in LA and so prefer somebody in this area.
  • We are open to the possibility of work from home for the right person.
  • The work is challenging, with very compelling problems that touch on complex machine learning algorithms and scalability issues.
  • The work matters, and can have a huge impact on the economy and the environment.
  • You'll have the autonomy to direct your own work without being micromanaged.

Apply for this position

If this sounds interesting, please email us at jobs@tallygo.com. Please send your resume, links to a code repo or portfolio of your work, and tell us why Van Halen's standard performance contract contained a provision calling for them to be provided backstage with a bowl of M&Ms from which all the brown candies had been removed. Also, take a guess at why we are asking for that.Principals only, please, no recruiters.

items.title: Junior Web Developer
items.content:
At Netlify, we’re building a platform to empower digital designers and developers to build better, more elaborate web projects than ever before. We’re aiming to change the landscape of modern web development.

The Junior Web Developer's mission is to build the APIs and user interfaces that thousands of developers use when they deploy their sites on Netlify.

This opportunity is to work with us in San Francisco. However, we'd consider remote applications from engineers with experience working remotely in fast moving startups, that are within +- 3 hours of California PST.

Some of the challenges you’ll be working on:

  • Build new features to make working with Netlify a fantastic experience for developers.
  • Build internal tools to help our other teams interact with our users.
  • Integrate our Open Source projects with the rest of Netlify’s platform.
  • Make using our CLI a delightful experience for new and experienced users.

    To be effective in this role, you’ll benefit from experience in:

  • Highly scalable APIs.
  • Building web applications with Ruby and Rails.
  • Writing web applications with a decoupled JavaScript frontend.
  • UI and UX experience.
  • Web and CDN technologies.
  • Internet standards like HTTP, DNS, and TLS.

    Competencies that we value in candidates:

  • You enjoy helping and mentoring other engineers to grow.
  • You can focus on key priorities and pragmatic solutions.
  • You can adjust quickly to changing priorities and conditions.
  • You are curious about compiled programming languages. We use Go and C++ in some areas of our infrastructure.

    About the team

    Though the team is small, we are a fast-growing startup. You will be working across the company. There are only twenty of us, so you are getting in at a time when we need people who can help us build a path towards the future.
    We believe that empowered, engaged employees do the best work. We’ll be giving you the tools you need to succeed and looking to you for suggestions for improvement not just in your daily job, but in many other aspects of building a company. Whether you work from our main office in San Francisco, or you are a remote employee, we’ll be working together a lot - particularly, pairing and collaborating - we want you to succeed! We don’t want you to work too hard (burnout is real), and we do want to encourage you to grow (impostor syndrome is also real) - and we’ll help you do that.
    Netlify is devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, race, citizenship, pregnancy status, or any other differences. If we can do anything to provide a better interview, i.e. accommodate a disability, then please do let us know.

    How we hire

    After we evaluate your application, we will schedule a conference call so we can meet. If you live in San Francisco, we usually substitute this call with a visit to our office. This first meeting helps us to learn more about your past experience and helps you to learn a little bit more about our company and how we work.

    If we move forward with the process, we will work together in designing a test to evaluate your technical skills. We’ll invite you to join a dedicated Slack channel where we can reach each other and talk about the test.

    If the test is successful, we’ll schedule a next meeting with other members of the company that you’ll be working with, directly or indirectly.

    After this third interview, you’ll meet with the management team to discuss salary and other compensations.

items.title: NodeJS Developer @ Linux Academy
items.content:
NodeJS Developer @ Linux Academy

2017-10-26 11:51

Description
DESCRIPTION

NodeJS Developers at Linux Academy are tasked with building the next generation of our software using JavaScript in an event-driven context. Employees are expected to build solutions for existing and new products using serverless infrastructure and modern programming techniques. This allows us to solve inefficiencies in our products and stay ahead of the curve as leaders in both technology education and education technology.

Develop Node.js software

  • Write Lambda handlers to make event-driven Linux Academy tasks more efficient
  • Contribute to JavaScript-based open source projects that Linux Academy uses

Work on Serverless Academy offerings

  • Plan and write code and systems that will become part of the Serverless LMS.
  • Maintain Serverless Blog with feature additions and bugfixes.

Maintain open source projects

  • Vet and accept pull requests to Serverless Academy open source projects.
  • Respond to GitHub issue reports promptly and appropriately.
  • Help develop a community around Serverless Academy open source projects through discussion and interaction with users.
  • Help enforce contribution and code of conduct policies on Serverless Academy projects.

Evangelize Node and serverless technology to other employees

  • Find independent, modular elements of the existing Linux Academy stack that can be replaced by serverless architecture for increased efficiency and reduced cost.
  • Explain the benefits of using Node.js and/or serverless architecture to other Linux Academy employees.
  • Recognize when non-serverless solutions may be better for some applications, and fit those into our stack in a way that still follows the best practices of serverless architecture when viewed from a high level.
REQUIREMENTS
  • Familiarity with JavaScript development, particularly in the Node runtime.
  • Familiarity with and experience in event-driven programming.
  • Experience architecting solutions using at least one cloud computing provider with serverless offerings, such as Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure.
  • Knowledge of and passion for open source project organization, maintenance, and participation.
  • Able to write organized, thoroughly tested and documented code.
  • Can work with communicate with, and disagree with team members in a respectful manner.
  • You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship
  • If remote, must be able to travel to Keller, TX office occasionally and work during normal business hours
BENEFITS
  • Best in Industry compensation with bonus potential for high performers
  • Health, dental, vision, life insurance provided free to employee; discounted to spouse/family
  • Simple IRA with non-elective contribution made by Linux Academy
  • 3 weeks’ vacation, 1 week sick leave
  • Great family leave policy
  • Free snacks/drinks to on-site personnel
  • Casual work environment
  • Great creative, innovative and fun group of people to work with

Country

Anywhere*

Location

If remote, must be able to travel to Keller, TX office occasionally and work during normal business hours

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER – CONTROL SYSTEMS


We’re looking for talented software engineers with experience in building backend systems to join our team. This role is responsible for building, enhancing and maintaining the platform to deliver our core CDN configurations as well as our future Edge Cloud products. We have local offices in San Francisco, Portland and other locations. Remote workers are also encouraged to apply. Pacific time zone or close to is preferred.


To be effective in this role, you would have:



  • Experience with Perl, Go and other languages in interdependent environments.

  • Experience with database systems and applications.

  • Experience migrating data models, operating and deploying an always-on system.

  • Experience building APIs to handle complex and sensitive data.

  • Experience in distributed systems, caching and HTTP APIs.

  • Experience improving the reliability and efficiency of fault-tolerant distributed systems.

  • Experience with database and system profiling.


We value a variety of voices, so this is not a laundry list.  You’ll be a good candidate if you have experience and/or interest in SOME of these:



  • Maintaining and developing large-scale and/or global production systems

  • Linux/UNIX systems, both high and low level

  • Writing code that is performant, maintainable, clear, and concise

  • Expertise in designing, analyzing, profiling, and troubleshooting APIs and large-scale, distributed systems

  • Experience with software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documentation, release deployment)


Fastly provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant’s race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status or veteran status. 


Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

items.title: Ben Loop: JavaScript & React Programmer
items.content:
JavaScript & React Programmer

Posted Oct 25

Ben Loop
Headquarters: Ostrava, Czech Republic
https://benloop.com

Who we are

In Ben Loop we are developing custom-made mobile and web applications. We focus on long-term cooperation in projects and we collaborate with clients from around the globe. Besides the Czech Republic, they are from Spain, Germany and USA at the moment.

Our clients include advanced start-ups as well as bigger and well-established companies and their internal start-ups.

  

What will your working day look like

Ben Loop was founded by two freelancers and, perhaps, that’s why we put great emphasis on personal freedom.

You can start when you want in the morning and decide yourself where you’re going to work. We usually work remotely in Ben Loop, but there are certain periods when we gladly go to our office in Ostrava, Czech Republic.

First thing in the morning we have a stand-up via Slack. The stand-up time may vary and is always arranged by mutual agreement. Some prefer starting early, others work better later.

We usually discuss the previous day’s issues as well as tasks for the current day at the stand-up.

Everyone then works on their assignments during the day and any other potential communication is carried on via Basecamp/Github/Slack. Nobody checks anybody as for when and how they work – only the results are important.

During the day and at the end of it, we commit the work in a standard way to Github where another developer always performs Code Review for you after you complete a task.

We usually work in this way for our clients 4 days a week, the fifth day is dedicated to education, open source or other development activities we don’t have time for during the week.

  
Who we are looking for

We are looking for developers for long-term cooperation from Europe who have experience with Javascript & React, enjoy working on frontend and have active open source profile. We don’t mind if you have contributions to another project or you have your own open projects and apps, but visible activity on Github, for at least several past months, is important for us.

Another important thing for us is the ability to learn new things, open-mindedness, a common touch and the ability to deal with problems independently.

  
What we can gradually offer to you

Not just any degree of freedom
Remote work and flexible working hours (please read – you work no more than 8 hours, when you decide, not from sun to sun).

Extra holiday
Everybody in Ben Loop can take as much paid holiday as they want. We consider rest as an inseparable part of work and therefore we don’t prevent anybody from taking time off when it’s needed.

New hardware on a regular basis
Everyone gets a new MacBook and iPhone or an Android phone (of your choice) every two or three years.

A load of other benefits
Everyone in Ben Loop can choose other benefits which suit them best. The standard ones include sport, massage or education benefits, holiday allowance and more.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position please send a short summarization of your work experience to daniel@benloop.com. Please don’t send us a typical CV, nobody will read it. Also open source activity or open projects are required for this positions, so don’t forget to add a link to your Github profile. We accept only the applicants who live in the Europe. Please add “55” at the end of the subject of your email - we will ignore all other emails without it.

items.title: Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create
items.content:
Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create

2017-10-24 19:17

Description

In this role you will be converting a PHP monolithic app to an API Microservices architecture app using ReactJS, Redux, Node, GraphQL and MySQL.

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

Responsibilities

  • Write lots of quality, high performing JavaScript code
  • Architecture and development of the web apps in ReactJS, Redux
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to deliver functionality for a highly visible web app for a leading educational services company
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices

Required Skills and Experience

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of front-end MVC architectures
  • Strong experience with ReactJS and Redux
  • Strong Javascript basis and very good understand of the JS core (ES6/7)
  • Strong experience with GraphQL
  • Good understanding of PHP is a strong plus
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with at least one of the SCSS compilers: Sass or Less
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment* A consistent, reliable internet connection

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

items.title: Lead Verifactor/Developer, Telecom. - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Lead Verifactor/Developer, Telecom.
Crossover -Remote
$30 an hour
Lead Verificator/Developer (Telecom) - $60K

Do you have 5 to 10 years of experience in Development for Charging in BE, BTech Electronics, Electrical, Information Science, Telecom, MCA? If so, this role may be a great fit for you.

Job Description:
Reporting to the Global Head of Customer System Architecture, you will be responsible to deliver a wide array of projects for our Strategic Customers in the OSS/BSS field. As a Lead Verificator/Developer you will be a technical point of contact in terms of proposing, creating and implementing bespoke solutions for key clients.

Company Description:
Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor based model, does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams. Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Key responsibilities:
Understands of Customer requirements(Solution Proposal, R-Spec., Ticket Spec etc), and product features of BSS portfolio

Evaluate and analyze R-Spec and 3rd party interface specification according to contract requirements

Develops value added IN services based on technologies/protocols like INAP, CAP, MAP, GPRS, CORBA, Diameter, and so on -DEV related only-

Customizes product configuration for the customer solution (database, settings, configurations)

Performs trace analysis

Test Case Identification and Feature Coverage Check

Participation in customer and internal Workshops

Definition of Integration Concept and Test Specification -VER related only-

Planning and Set-up of customer specific test-lab configuration according to contract requirements

Plans test strategy for module testing & perform functionality tests according to test plan

Analyze fault situations, identify faulty units / parameters; detect and describe interoperability weak points

Provisioning of Symptom Data for error corrections

Documentation of test progress and project reporting

Preparation of Customer and internal procedures and release documentation

Follow -up with Development on critical issues and solving the same

Processing of Fault Reports, technical queries, provisioning of fault corrections and SW updates, writing test status reports, Emergency Handling

SW Release Management

Acceptance support using ATMN as base of test case execution (including onsite)

Required experience and education:
Personal attributes

Results oriented, innovative, and takes initiative

Team player

CPP/Milestone target

Agile methodology + scrum team

CI & Jenkins know how

PRIMA,WMIP, Emergency Info and Service Info -PITAC related only-

Service management interfaces

SS7

CAP

MAP

TCP/IP

Diameter

Product expertise

charge@once Unified

IPD/ngIPD

SS7 Dispatcher

Service management interfaces (Example: Batch interface)

Trace analysis

Total compensation: $30/hour ($60K/year)

Position type:
40 hours per week

Location

: Global (remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify

, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

Are you up for the challenge?

Lead Verificator/Developer (Telecom) - $60K

Do you have 5 to 10 years of experience in Development for Charging in BE, BTech Electronics, Electrical, Information Science, Telecom, MCA? If so, this role may be a great fit for you.

Job Description:
Reporting to the Global Head of Customer System Architecture, you will be responsible to deliver a wide array of projects for our Strategic Customers in the OSS/BSS field. As a Lead Verificator/Developer you will be a technical point of contact in terms of proposing, creating and implementing bespoke solutions for key clients.

Company Description:
Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor based model, does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams. Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Key responsibilities:
Understands of Customer requirements(Solution Proposal, R-Spec., Ticket Spec etc), and product features of BSS portfolio

Evaluate and analyze R-Spec and 3rd party interface specification according to contract requirements

Develops value added IN services based on technologies/protocols like INAP, CAP, MAP, GPRS, CORBA, Diameter, and so on -DEV related only-

Customizes product configuration for the customer solution (database, settings, configurations)

Performs trace analysis

Test Case Identification and Feature Coverage Check

Participation in customer and internal Workshops

Definition of Integration Concept and Test Specification -VER related only-

Planning and Set-up of customer specific test-lab configuration according to contract requirements

Plans test strategy for module testing & perform functionality tests according to test plan

Analyze fault situations, identify faulty units / parameters; detect and describe interoperability weak points

Provisioning of Symptom Data for error corrections

Documentation of test progress and project reporting

Preparation of Customer and internal procedures and release documentation

Follow -up with Development on critical issues and solving the same

Processing of Fault Reports, technical queries, provisioning of fault corrections and SW updates, writing test status reports, Emergency Handling

SW Release Management

Acceptance support using ATMN as base of test case execution (including onsite)

Required experience and education:
Personal attributes

Results oriented, innovative, and takes initiative

Focuses on customer, has good communication skills, Assertiveness

Ability to analyze, learn, and be self-driven

Team player

We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

Are you up for the challenge?

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr

2017-10-23 03:15

Description

Who We Are

Sprinklr is 1,300 employees strong, valued at $1.8 billion, and one of the fastest growing companies in the history of enterprise software.

In the age of the empowered and connected customer, we know that every experience a customer has with a brand matters...a lot.

That’s why -- from the very beginning -- Sprinklr set out to build a powerful, agnostic, and first-of-its-kind “social operating system” that integrates with an organization’s existing tech infrastructure and allows employees across the front office to collaborate more effectively and deliver superior customer experiences across every social channel.

Today, we’re revolutionizing customer engagement in 75+ countries for more than 1000 of the most recognized brands, including Nike, JPMorgan Chase, Verizon, McDonald’s, Microsoft, P&G, Uber, and more than 50% of the Fortune 50.

We’ve spent the last six years building the world’s most complete enterprise social technology. Now we’re leveraging that market-leading position to help the biggest brands on the planet take on one of the largest opportunities ever in enterprise software: unifying the front office.

And we’re bringing the very best talent in the world together to get there.

What You'll Do

We are currently seeking a person with extensive development and consulting experience. Full-stack software engineers with experience in a wide variety of technologies are preferred. It is imperative that you not only know your way around various front-end and back-end architectures, but can also walk a technical or non-technical customer through the process of integrating two business systems.

In this role you will be leading customer integration activities as well as rolling up your sleeves when it’s needed.

What Are Your Responsibilities

  • Consult with internal and external customers in a highly complex technical environment
  • Provide solutions using creative problem solving, technical expertise and strong understanding of underlying business requirements and best practices.
  • Write proof-of-concept applications using available SDKs and APIs
  • Research, design and implement solutions to highly ambiguous problems
  • Provided guidance to customers who are implementing solutions using the Sprinklr API.
  • Analyze API source code and assist product and documentation teams identifying gaps in the documentation.
  • Maintain knowledge of the Sprinklr application and architecture.
  • Work closely with the Product Support, Customer Success, Client Services and Development teams to resolve application issues and plan for changes, upgrades, enhancements and new customer provisioning.
  • Document operational procedures
  • Inspire, grow and lead junior consultants
  • Follow industry trends and developments to provide new ideas and recommendations on processes and products.

Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • Minimum of 6+ years of experience building scalable web based applications
  • Minimum of 3 years experience developing backend systems in Java
  • Solid understanding of web application security and vulnerabilities (such as the OWASP top 10 list).
  • Experience designing and consuming REST based API services.
  • Proficient in HTML, JavaScript (ES6), and/or CSS.
  • Familiar with source control management systems (git is preferred).
  • Experience with NoSql databases such as MongoDB and ElasticSearch
  • Experience with Message Queuing Systems such as Kafka
  • Experience with Javascript Frameworks such as Express, React, Redux
  • Experience with Spring, Spring Boot and Spring Cloud
  • Experience with Docker, AWS, Azure and deployment strategies
  • Comfortable working in a UNIX environment.
  • Experience with Social Media and CRM Integrations

While our strong preference is for this position to be in Austin TX, we recognize that great talent can be found all over and will consider remote work candidates from anywhere in the U.S.

You know You're Successful if….

You’re just as comfortable writing code as you are having a conversation with someone about writing code. The right person for this job will have extensive development experience but have more to offer than your average software engineer.

If you habitually analyze business processes and find yourself designing databases and writing APIs in your mind in order to make sense of a process you might be exactly the person we’re looking for.

Country

United States

items.title: Developer Evangelist @ Wallaroo Labs
items.content:
Developer Evangelist @ Wallaroo Labs

2017-10-23 03:06

Description

Wallaroo Labs is working on a huge idea, and this is a phenomenal opportunity for a person who enjoys challenges. We believe in open source and strive to build on these technologies. Our distributed team is ten people and growing. We had have generated a lot of interest through our product and vision and raised a large seed round with several well-known VCs.

Faster data, more data sources, and business requirements are driving increasingly sophisticated algorithms and putting more and more demands on data applications. Wallaroo Labs solves these problems with Wallaroo, a data engine for building highly elastic big data applications.

We are looking for a Developer Evangelist to drive the adoption of Wallaroo open-source offering within the developer community. This position is essential to our success; you will be responsible for identifying friction points with Wallaroo and systematically eliminate to improve the developer experience.

Although Wallaroo's headquarters is in New York, this position can be remote. Candidates located in a Tech Hub cities or that have deep connections within existing developer networks would prove invaluable in building our community.

Responsibilities

  • Monitor communication channels (HN, Reddit, StackOverflow, Mailing lists, IRC) and interact with the community, answer questions and assist developers.
  • Identify and build relationships with the developer community, meetups, and conferences and leverage relationships to evangelize Wallaroo.
  • Own problem resolution and participate with the development team to create solutions.
  • Publish content from blog posts to video demos.

Qualities we are looking for

  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
  • Comfortable with a variety of programming languages, experience with Python, Go, JavaScript are a plus.
  • Familiar with Big Data technologies.
  • Desire and ability to work with enterprise clients and our open source community.
  • Experience working with open source software, GitHub etc.
  • Familiar with software development process in a business setting.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.

Learn more about Wallaroo

  • Corporate site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com
  • Wallaroo Community Site: http://www.wallaroolabs.com/community
  • Wallaroo Blog: https://blog.wallaroolabs.com/
  • GitHub: https://github.com/WallarooLabs/wallaroo

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: ServiceNow Developer - Information Techology Coalition, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
ServiceNow Developer
Information Techology Coalition, Inc. -Remote
– Job Description
ITC has an opportunity for a dynamic ServiceNow Developer to support the Department of Commerce Headquarters (DOC HQ) as a sub to CSRA. The primary work location will be remote, with travel for periods of time to CSRA’s office Arlington, VA with frequent travel to DOC HQ in Washington, DC. CSRA is pursuing an opportunity at this customer that will support the creation of a DOC-wide shared services infrastructure (SSI). This role requires a dynamic contributor who can manage and configure ServiceNow applications and modules, develop new products, and perform some system administration tasks. This is a greenfield environment so candidates need to understand all aspects of the product and be experienced in implementing all modules. The role will require good customer-facing skills and outstanding written and verbal communication. In addition, the ServiceNow Developer will need to be collaborative and work closely with business analysis, testing, and support teams in implementing, testing, and supporting the solution.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders, business analysts, and UX analysts in interpreting requirements into ServiceNow. This will include prototyping solutions in ServiceNow. Contribute to the strategic development of new platform customizations, as needed, based on customer needs Participate in the collection and implementation of tool requirements and investigate, as necessary, to determine the best solution or configuration options available based on the specific requirement Develop detailed designs for the implementation of new products and capabilities built on ServiceNow as well as for the integration with downstream systems Participate in the design and development of a single sign-on security solution Engage in a full agile development process including detailed design, development, unit testing, and configuration management Identify, diagnose, research, track, and resolve technical issues within the platform & user work flows. Manages accounts/groups and their memberships within ServiceNow Provides assistance with report configuration and maintenance, as needed Performs operational administrative tasks, as needed Actively collaborates with other teammates to perform code reviews and discuss new developments and projects Produce all required deliverables

Requirements:
Qualifications:
Years of Experience: 8 years of IT experience with at least 3 years of direct ServiceNow experienceRequired Education: Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or equivalent; Master’s degree preferredRequired Certification: ServiceNow Certified System AdministratorDesired Certification: ServiceNow Certified Application Developer, Certified Implementation SpecialistExpert in understanding and developing on the core ServiceNow platform, including administration, support, break/fix and API’s.Experienced in developing user friendly catalog items with experience writing orchestration workflows such as Content Management, LDAP, Web Services, Active Directory and Custom ActivitiesMust understand best practices and proper implementations of the ServiceNow platform.Must demonstrate analytical and initiative taking abilities, while being self-motivated with a strong customer focus.Experienced with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS; Java/JEE experience highly preferredAbility to work and deliver high quality services in a demanding environment under aggressive deadlinesExperienced working in an Agile lifecycleOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsPermanent Residency or US Citizenship RequiredMust be eligible for a Public Trust Clearance

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Location: Flexible (Boston preferred)


For candidates interested in working remotely, you bring demonstrated experience and previous success working remotely


Position is available: August 2017


THE OPPORTUNITY


Now that ANet is more than ten years old, the Engineering Team is redesigning many of our existing Java-based software systems. We started with our content creation platform, which is used to design student assessments. We recently went into production with a new stack of Go-based microservices. We are now working on revamping the system that delivers this content to students, as well as reporting the results.


Reporting to the Director of Engineering, this Senior Software Engineer will play a key role in crafting and implementing our technology vision for the organization.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about cutting-edge development and best practices and able to work across the stack. We are looking for a flexible and adaptable engineer with some of the following skills and/or enthusiasm for learning and growing in these areas:



  • Server-side development using Java and/or Go programming languages to build scalable, RESTful web services.

  • Data-focused engineering in both SQL and NoSQL (Mongo) environments.

  • Maintain and improve existing Data warehouse and ETL processes.

  • Design, promote, and implement data infrastructures that adhere to responsible data management principles.

  • Design and implement sustainable DevOps using AWS.


ANet is flexible to remote working with appropriate experience and a history of successfully mentoring other developers remotely. Occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston will be necessary, so proximity to the New England area and eastern time zone is preferable.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Play a leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying sustainable code for substantial features and systems.

  • Implement ANet’s next generation of technology products that support data-driven educational practices and help to close the achievement gap in the underserved communities we partner with.

  • Create, monitor and deliver against the product road map and corresponding release cycles (as negotiated with the Product Management Team).

  • Provide strategic leadership in setting goals and measuring progress in RESTful server-side APIs and/or agile, componentized client-side code.

  • Help manage, improve, and automate our deployment frameworks.

  • Keep abreast of new technologies and propose adoption as appropriate.

  • Mentor and support the development of junior developers as appropriate.

  • Actively embrace and model best practices such as code reviews, unit testing, and planning/scoping/vetting larger features.

  • Proactively look for ways to build our team through individual contributions which help us improve code quality, team culture, and team velocity.


WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING


In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:



  • You have direct experience in many of the following:




    • Java and/or Go programming language

    • Scrum or other Agile development processes

    • RESTful Web Services

    • Cloud-based data services, preferably with both SQL and NoSQL implementations

    • Cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, including continuous integration and deployment




  • You are a team player who motivates and educates colleagues; you enjoy working in a highly collaborative and agile culture.

  • You are skilled in working closely with business partners to build technology solutions that meet the usability and functional needs of both internal and external users.

  • You operate comfortably among a highly independent staff with diverse backgrounds.

  • You bring an innovative approach to analyze, evaluate and solve problems.

  • You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels.

  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily and are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values.


Preferred Qualifications:



  • 4+ years of software development experience

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree



ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Cherwell Software
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Cherwell Software

2017-10-21 13:41

Description

Cherwell Software delivers world-class IT Service Management (ITSM) solutions in an exciting and ever-evolving industry—while building lasting relationships with both our employees and customers. We are a global company with offices in the US, Europe, and Australia. We are stable, profitable and growing rapidly!

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Colorado, Seattle, or possibly remote.

Who Will Love This Job
  • A team player: You collaborate with other team members to solve problems and work together to achieve deadlines and departmental goals.
  • A learner: You learn quickly and maintain a diverse workload in a fast-paced environment.
  • A problem solver: You use rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions. You probe all fruitful sources for answers and you can see hidden problems. You look beyond the obvious and you don't stop at the first answer.
  • A smart cookie: You are bright and intelligent. You deal with concepts and complexity comfortably. People describe you as intellectually sharp, capable and agile.
  • Action Oriented: You enjoy working hard! You are full of energy for the things you find challenging. You are not afraid of acting quickly and you are willing to jump on problems quickly.
What You'll Do

We are looking for a software engineer with considerable expertise building enterprise-level web applications to join our innovative Engineering team. You will work on an Agile/Scrum team to develop different features for our product and will share your experience and knowledge to be a mentor to other developers. The ideal candidate is a strong developer with an eye for architecture who has built many of the following:

  • Highly-scalable web applications
  • Modern Client Side javascript oriented websites
  • Web services
  • Native desktop applications
  • Native mobile applications
  • Server-side components
What You Should Have
  • Ability to work within a very collaborative, team-oriented environment
  • Expert knowledge of C# and .Net 4.0 or later; Java experience may be considered.
  • Familiarity with Object-Oriented Programming concepts, including SOLID principles, Continuous Integration, Unit Testing, and Mocking
  • Experience developing web applications and web services in C# and .Net
  • Experience with client-side web technologies like JavaScript, Angular, Bootstrap, React, HTML, CSS, and other modern JS libraries
  • TypeScript
  • WinForms or WPF desktop development
  • An eye for a good user experience
  • N-tier application development experience using WCF, Web Services, Windows Services, and IIS
  • Using decentralized source control such as Git (or similar)
  • Experience building frameworks and meta-data based applications
  • Experience with software development in a compliance-oriented environment such as 508, FEDRAMP, FISMA and HIPAA
  • Application globalization and localization
  • Relational Database experience such as SQL Server a plus.
  • Basic understanding of Windows Server and IIS.
  • Web or desktop application security
Why Cherwell?
  • You like working with intelligent and driven colleagues
  • You would enjoy working for a fast-growing software company
  • Bragging rights – check out our awards!
  • We’re a fun, close-knit team
  • We have a fast-paced, exciting work environment
  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including health, dental, vision, and other benefits
  • PTO plan to provide work-life balance
  • 401(k) with employer matching program
  • Commuter perks for some locations
  • Paid community service day and philanthropy projects
  • Our work environments vary by location; however, we believe in offering amenities and fun activities to fuel our energy. You may find fully stocked micro kitchens, standing/sitting desks, free onsite gym, basketball and volleyball courts, ping pong, videogames, shuffleboard, and darts.
  • Fun group competitions, team outings, and new hire lunches with the CEO

Cherwell Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. We do not tolerate discrimination against any applicant on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, disability or age. Cherwell encourages diversity in hiring, recognizing that this enriches the work environment and that a broad variety of perspectives enhances decision-making and creativity. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US please send an email with your request to Recruiting@Cherwell.com.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo
items.content:
Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo

2017-10-21 13:05

Description

Department: Engineering

Location: (Multiple States)

Type: Full Time

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the code base is off limits.

Our current technologies include modern versions of Ember, React, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, C#, and F#. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, Sumo Logic, Datadog, and New Relic. We don’t expect you to have experience with everything in this list, and we’ll help you learn what you don’t know!

As a front-end engineer at Olo, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the hospitality industry. You will help us shape the digital guest experience for restaurant brands served by Olo. You will contribute to technology selection, architecture and user experience for our front-end applications.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Requirements

  • Experience building user interfaces that put users first and look and feel awesome to use
  • Deep knowledge of ES6/ES2015+ and one or more modern Javascript frameworks, with a preference for React or Ember
  • Demonstrable understanding of the full .NET web stack
  • Leadership experience that spans one or more aspects of technology selection, architecture and design oversight, and mentoring others
  • Superb problem solving skills with an emphasis on pragmatism, quality, and performance
  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Legal right to work in the U.S.

About Olo

Olo reaches millions of consumers by powering mobile and online ordering for many of the country’s largest restaurant chains. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption.

We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller. We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

United States

items.title: UX/UI Designer - ZevRoss Spatial Analysis - (Ithaca, NY) - FullTime
items.content:
• ZevRoss Spatial Analysis (Ithaca, NY)
  • Fulltime Job

    • UX/UI Designer

    Overview

    If you have a passion for great design and clean practical user interfaces we want to talk with you. We are looking for candidates with UX/UI skills and an artistic sensibility focused on typography, color, scale and composition. A candidate with experience working with data and producing data visualizations would fit in particularly well. The designer would work closely with our senior software engineer and the rest of the team to bring life to data-driven web apps.

    Skills and Experience

    What you will do:

    • Collaborate with the senior software engineer and data scientists to determine required app functionality and initial workflow
    • Create wireframes and mockups to flesh out initial brainstorms
    • Determine site-wide style guides for ensuring consistent design
    • Code and implement design ideas for application front-ends
    • Analyze usage data and traffic patterns

    Required skills:

    • Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles
    • Well-developed illustration, typographic layout, and artistic skills
    • Some professional experience in UI/UX design including design for mobile sites
    • Commanding knowledge of CSS, HTML and Adobe Creative Suite (or open source analogs) and strong working knowledge JavaScript
    • Proven experience in designing responsive websites and applications across desktop and mobile
    • Portfolio of interaction design and visual design
    • Strong drive to tackle coding challenges and come up with solutions
    • Ability to work in a small, fast-paced team setting
    • Excellent communication skills

    Bonus skills that strengthen your application:

    • Experience working with data: this might include web-based data skills such as experience with D3, HighCharts or other tools as well as experience using tools such R, Python or SQL.
    • Experience making interactive maps with tools such as Google Maps, Leaflet, Mapbox, CartoDB (or others)
    • Experience with geographic data, GIS, spatial analysis

    About us

    We are a growing data science shop focused on working with and visualizing data. A significant chunk of our work involves creating rich data-driven and interactive web apps usually with maps and other graphics to help clients tell a story.

    The data science industry has been growing dramatically over the past several years and you’ll have an opportunity to be part of projects that combine modern data analysis and visualization tools in an effort to make sense of data and convey key messages.

    Our office is in heart of downtown Ithaca, NY; a vibrant college town in the Finger Lakes of New York State. Ithaca is consistently listed as a great place to live due to its walkability, lively downtown and proximity to natural features (waterfalls!). For example, Ithaca was ranked:

    • Best college town in America (Business Insider)
    • 2nd Best Small College Town in the US (USA Today)
    • Top 25 Youngest Best Places to Live (CNN Money)
    • Top 10 Great Places to Live (Kiplinger’s Personal Finance)

    Benefits:

    • Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
    • Health and dental benefits
    • Health savings account/flexible savings account
    • Performance-based end of year bonus
    • Paid vacation and additional paid sick/personal time off
    • Paid maternity and paternity leave
    • A commitment to work-life balance

    To apply:

    This position is intended to be full-time and local in Ithaca. We would consider less than full-time and/or remote work but your interest in a part-time/remote position must be included in your cover letter.

    Send application materials to jobs@zevross.com. The subject should be “Application for UX/UI Position”. Questions about the position should also be e-mailed to jobs@zevross.com but the subject should be “Question about UX/UI Position”.

    Your application materials should include:

    A cover letter explaining your experience and reason for wanting this position. Indicate in the cover letter whether you are willing to work full-time in Ithaca, NY. Please include a brief discussion of how you work and what kind of tools you like to use.

    • A resume/CV
    • A list of three references
    • Links to relevant portfolio material, this can include existing websites, materials on GitHub or other materials that can help us evaluate your work.

    How to apply

items.title: Senior Python Developer
items.content:
Location: Remote, Europe
Job Type: Full Time
Start Date: Available immediately



Summary

A Senior Python Developer based anywhere in Europe is sought by DigitalMR to work on our innovative market research project, listening247®. Aspects of this job include designing, developing, testing, and deploying new cutting edge software solutions to help further advance our web platforms. This is a full time placement with a competitive salary and significant opportunities for innovation, growth, and advancement.



The Company

DigitalMR is an early stage high tech company in the space of market research and marketing. Following 4 years of focussed R&D in A.I. - financed by multiple government grants and self generated cash - we have developed a lot of unique I.P. some of which is patent pending. The main areas of our research are: text analytics - NLP, sentiment & semantic analysis, emotion detection and scoring, automated image theme and sentiment analysis. We work with blue-chip multinationals such as P&G, SABMiller, DIAGEO, Vodafone, Saxo Bank, YPO, Nielsen, TNS, and many more. We are already disrupting a 60 Billion US$ industry.



Requirements:

Having a great fit with the DigitalMR company values
Web development experience in Python, and extensive experience in Javascript will be an advantage
Knowledge of frameworks such as Django or Flask will be an advantage
Prior experience with NoSQL and SQL, and knowledge of Elasticsearch, Cassandra, MongoDB will be an advantage
Record in building modular, reusable, and well-documented code
Working knowledge of the Git version control system and its preferred development workflows
Good organisational skills both in management of time and software code


Good to have:

Good HTML/XHTML/CSS/Javascript skills
Experience with cutting-edge Javascript single-page app frameworks such as React and Angular
Server provisioning and administration in the context of application deployment - experience with tools such as Ansible or Puppet in particular
Experience and/or interest in building a modern SaaS platform, including progress of user onboarding, engagement, analytics.
Experience in building and interfacing with clean REST APIs.
Github account with publicly available code samples.


Roles and Responsibilities:

­Working closely with a dynamic team of software engineers to realise web based platforms


Benefits:

­The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about technology and innovation
­Flat structure, no bureaucracy, and lots of autonomy
­A competitive salary + bonus
Working from home

items.content:
Opsview is looking for a talented Full Stack Javascript Developer to join our Engineering team to help us revolutionise the Front End of our Product.

Why Opsview?
We are passionately focused on building the best monitoring software on the market. We hire people that are ambitious for success. We like to get things done, with good processes and systems in place, so we can operate efficiently and scale smoothly. We are constantly striving to improve the way we work and have fun along the way!

We are looking for someone with the following experience and expertise:

items.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Remote or Local) - Evanios - Remote
items.content:
Sr. Software Engineer (Remote or Local)
Evanios -Remote

*This position may be located at our Orlando, FL headquarters, or remote . Resume and cover letter are required.

Looking to ramp up your career with a fast growing software company? Check out Evanios!

We build software that automates IT Operations processes for complex organizations. Our product consolidates IT alert/event data, uses machine learning to predict technology failures, and reduce downtime. Used primarily by Fortune 1000 customers, our flagship SaaS application enhances ServiceNow™, a dominant platform for enterprise companies. We’re expanding rapidly, so we’re looking for the right people to join our team.

This isn’t “just another” tech job.

Evanios is red-hot and values-based. We can proudly boast an exceptionally high renewal rate - the most honest measure of customer satisfaction. We exist to blow our customers’ minds, build an environment in which our team members thrive, and revolutionize the industry. To fit in here you’ll need to demonstrate an awesome work ethic, high initiative and a great sense of humor...we work hard, enjoy each other’s company and have a ton of fun.

Your Role

You will build software that changes the industry and blows our customers’ minds. Your ideas and actions will drive our evolution. As an instrumental player on our development team, you will leverage Agile and SCRUM methodologies, lead design teams, and manage the creation and release of new features. An overachieving software guru who applies a laser-sharp focus on user experience, you’ll continuously improve our software with leading edge machine learning capabilities, while leveraging the most scalable, secure architectures available.

Additionally, you will…

  • Improve and extend Evanios software using technologies like JavaScript, Kafka, MySQL, Percona MySQL, OrientDB, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Java, REST, SQL, NoSQL, HTML, and ServiceNow
  • Drive decisions on UI/UX design and usability
  • Oversee product packaging, scalability, and beta tests
  • Perform unit testing for usability and functionality
  • Manage the development of new features by collaborating with other team members
  • Design, document, and work from stories in our Agile/Scrum process
  • Become an expert with the Evanios technology stack (aka: be an Evanios Guru)

Required Skills & Experience:

  • BS or B Tech Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, related or equivalent foreign degree
  • 5 years experience as Sr. Applications Developer, Sr. Software Engineer, Technical Architect/Project Lead or related
  • Proficiency in JavaScript, Java, and SQL
  • Expertise with Apache Kafka, Percona MySQL, and OrientDB is a plus
  • Familiarity with DevOps methodologies for rapid code deployment
  • Great analytical capacity and proven technical aptitude – you breathe tech, you’re wicked smart and other people say so (They should also say they enjoy working with you…)
  • Applied experience with machine learning, IT automation, and predictive analytics
  • Some experience with IT monitoring tools (things like Nagios, SolarWinds, BMC, DataDog, SCOM, Zabbix, etc.)
  • Ability to quickly get up to speed on the Evanios platform and technologies (hint: a cover letter explaining how you have similar things previously would be a good idea)
  • A strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit – for real. We’re not looking for people who wait to be told what to do. We’re a company of go-getters who identify opportunities or problems then create solutions.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal. You may be in customer facing situations, so interviewing well through email, over the phone and in person creates an important first impression.

If you like to build things, and really want to see and feel the impact of your work then Evanios might be for you. We offer a competitive salary, generous vacation, medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k, paid life insurance, career growth opportunity, and a great work environment.

Please note: Your resume and cover letter are both required for consideration. Applications without either component will be disregarded.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • ServiceNow: 3 years
  • SQL, MySQL, NoSQL: 3 years
  • Application Development: 5 years
  • Javascript: 3 years

Required language:

  • English

items.title: Web Application Developer (MEAN Stack)
items.content:
JOB DESCRIPTION

If you are passionate about technology then this is for you.

We are looking for a part-time and a full-time MEAN stack developer (Interns) to work on our AI platform and various cloud based applications that power it in the backend. We are looking for somebody who is absolutely enthusiastic about technology and has a passion for code.

This is a part-time / full-time paid internship with a high probability of a full-time position upon completion of internship. Growth potential is huge as we are furiously building an A class team. You will be working under the mentorship of some of the most brilliant minds in technology and business.


ABOUT US.

Crossing35.com an Edinburgh based tech start-up that is building an Artificial Intelligence enabled platform to help CEOs tap global markets. At the moment, we are a small team of 6, most of whom are specialist technical and business experts.

The work culture is quite informal but professional. We are currently hot-desking out of CodeBase in Edinburg as we wait for an office space allocation there. We like sitting together and working together as a team, but it is not uncommon for us to work occasionally from home, or meet at our CEOs flat for a brain storming session over beer and pizza (or curry or burger).

We also love playing table-tennis in the middle of our workday.

WORKING HOURS

We normally work together at CodeBase from Mon-Fri (9am -5pm) but are flexible on time and are willing to work around your academic schedule.

SKILLS – MUST HAVE

- Experience with Javascript & styling frameworks (AngularJS, Bootstrap, ReactJS)
- Experience with backend technologies (NodeJS)
- Experience with NoSQL databases e.g. MongoDB.
- Proven ability to rapidly pick up new technologies, frameworks and skills
- Experience with version control systems like GIT

DESIRABLE…

- Agile development methodologies and Continuous Integration, Testing and Deployment.
- Prior experience of developing front-end systems for startups would be a significant bonus.
- Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills;
- The ambition and enthusiasm to drive the company forward
- Knowledge of cloud based technologies like Heroku, AWS and Microsoft Azure.
- Knowledge on other programming languages like python, go, is an added advantage.

items.title: Front-end Web Developer (HTML & CSS Specialist)
items.content:
MyFutureNow is a pension tracing and consolidation service that locates workplace and personal pensions that have been lost or disconnected from the policyholder. Users of our service can also consolidate the pensions that we trace, to make their pension pot easier to manage and give them a better return when they retire.

We are looking for an experienced front-end web developer, to help us develop new customer-led features, and to improve our current service both functionally and visually.

We need someone who is smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. Someone who wants to work in a startup environment and likes the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what they work on. Someone with ideas about everything, isn’t afraid to argue their point (while respecting everyone else’s of course) and is constantly thinking “How can we do this better?”.

Who you are:

* You have at least 2 years of commercial experience working as a front-end developer.
* You have excellent HTML, CSS (and "plain-old" Javascript) coding skills, with the ability to produce responsive, cross-browser, interactive web pages.
* Your interest in development extends past coding; you have a passion for products and a perspective on user experience and product design.
* An independent streak is essential – although you will work closely with other members of our team, you will be required at times to drive work forward without being spoon-fed.
* Ideally you have already worked within a development team using web frameworks such as Ruby-on-Rails or Elixir-Phoenix, as you will be assisting our back-end development team with the integration of your front-end code with the rest of the application.
* **Note:** We are _not currently_ looking for a pure "Javascript Framework" developer (e.g. Angular.js, ReactJS experience is not required), we are looking for a HTML and CSS specialist who can work turn designs and prototypes into working web-pages. However, any exposure to these technologies would be useful to help with scoping future application requirements.

What you’ll do:

* Collaborate closely with our UX designers, strategists, CTO and back-end developers, to turn ideas into working features.
* Develop our products and services across web, mobile, and other touch devices (HTML web application, native mobile not required)
* Work using “Source Control” (i.e. Github) and “Pull Requests” to ensure a high level of quality in your code and an excellent end product for our customers.
* Use Agile techniques to iteratively ship products in a small, self-organised team.

How to apply:

* This position will be based in our Dublin office, but regular visits to our London and Bristol offices will are required. Some remote working may be possible, but we are not looking for fully-remote developers.
* If you have done any open-source work, links (e.g. Github projects) would be welcome. However, we recognise that not all companies allow such work, and absence of this will not be counted against your application.
* This is a permanent, salaried position. Salary will based on experience.
* No recruitment companies please.
