items.title: Back-end Developer - GatherContent Ltd - (Remote anywhere in the UK) - FullTime
items.content:
• GatherContent Ltd (Remote anywhere in the UK)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Back-end Developer

    About GatherContent

    GatherContent is a SaaS platform which helps teams organise and produce lots of content for websites. The platform enhances content development workflow, saving our customers time and money.

    We launched in 2012 and have bootstrapped our way to profitability.

    GatherContent is used by thousands of customers all over the world including Intel, Ogilvy, JWT, Spotify and Harvard University.

    GatherContent has a small office presence in London but we are remote by default. The team works from up and down the UK.

    The Role

    We’re looking for an experienced, UK-based Back-end Developer who wants to be part of a remote-working, fast growing startup (we’ve been around for a few years). You will be working as part of our Agile, 8 person team to help deliver iterations to our product.

    • Start date: as soon as possible
    • Pay: £40,000 per/annum (Plus benefits)
    • Full-time role
    • Based anywhere in UK. Remote or on-site (we have an office in London and offer budget for co-working spaces or to support your home office)

    Please be aware that although the position is remote, we will need you to travel to London during the interview process, and attend a team day (usually in London) every four months.

    What we need

    • Your undivided passion, energy, focus and enthusiasm for both the role and our business.
    • A self-starter attitude with experience managing and prioritising your own workload.
    • An ability to get things done quickly (whilst maintaining quality); working to a pace.
    • A team-player who works as well with others as well as individually.
    • Strong opinions, loosely held – you have no fear when it comes to contributing ideas and participating in discussions with the team. You’re also happy to take critique, self-improve and move forward fast.
    • Innovation – you need to be open and willing to adopt new ways of working. Our processes are constantly evolving and we always look to take a lean approach.
    • Customer focus – You should always be thinking, “What can I be doing to deliver the most value to our customers?”
    • Leave your ego at the door. We make decisions based on what’s right for the company, no exceptions.
    • Integrity- you do the right thing and know how to set expectations
    • Direct feedback- you’re comfortable giving and receiving feedback
    • Continuous improvement- you’re always looking for ways to better yourself and company processes
    • Wellness- you live a balanced routine and avoid heroism or burnout

    The skills we’re looking for are

    • Attention to Software Design and System Architecture
    • Experience with Object Orientated PHP and SOLID principles
    • Laravel 5
    • Coding standards (PSR2)
    • Composer dependancy management tool
    • Domain Modelling
    • Test Driven Development
    • Continuous Integration and Delivery
    • Agile Development Principles

    Bonus points for experience with

    • Working remotely
    • Working in a startup environment (especially on a saas product)
    • Knowledge of content management systems
    • Real time web applications
    • Experience with other parts of our stack (Node.js, React)
    • Virtual machines (Vagrant, Chef)

    What we can offer you

    • Remote working: work from anywhere within the UK (so long as there’s decent WIFI!)
    • Family friendly: family always comes first, supported by our flexible outlook
    • Work/life balance: we work a 35 hour week and encourage downtime and a healthy lifestyle. It’s about quality over quantity (one of our values is wellness!)
    • 32 days annual leave
    • The chance to make a real impact on our business: We’re a small team of 18 so there’s a huge opportunity for everyone to contribute, collaborate and make their mark.
    • Fun times: We get together at the London office every four months for a team day. Past activities have varied from anything like volunteering on a city farm to doing a 3D printing workshop or just making lots of chocolate truffles :)
    • Competitive salary, stock options, pension and other benefits such as remote working budget and a budget for conferences, books and online learning resources.

    You also need to include the word ‘asparagus’ in your cover letter to show that you’ve read the job role (this helps us weed out time wasters!)

    Closing date: 31 December 2017

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

    How to apply

    https://gathercontent.workable.com/jobs/585506

items.title: GatherContent: Back-end Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere in the UK)

DESCRIPTION

About GatherContent

GatherContent is a SaaS platform which helps teams organise and produce lots of content for websites. The platform enhances content development workflow, saving our customers time and money.

We launched in 2012 and have bootstrapped our way to profitability.

GatherContent is used by thousands of customers all over the world including Intel, Ogilvy, JWT, Spotify and Harvard University.

GatherContent has a small office presence in London but we are remote by default. The team works from up and down the UK.

 

The Role

We're looking for an experienced, UK-based Back-end Developer who wants to be part of a remote-working, fast growing startup (we’ve been around for a few years). You will be working as part of our Agile, 8 person team to help deliver iterations to our product.

  • Start date: as soon as possible
  • Pay: £40,000 per/annum (Plus benefits)
  • Full-time role
  • Based anywhere in UK. Remote or on-site (we have an office in London and offer budget for co-working spaces or to support your home office)

Please be aware that although the position is remote, we will need you to travel to London during the interview process, and attend a team day (usually in London) every four months.

 

REQUIREMENTS

What we need

  • Your undivided passion, energy, focus and enthusiasm for both the role and our business.
  • A self-starter attitude with experience managing and prioritising your own workload.
  • An ability to get things done quickly (whilst maintaining quality); working to a pace.
  • A team-player who works as well with others as well as individually.
  • Strong opinions, loosely held - you have no fear when it comes to contributing ideas and participating in discussions with the team. You’re also happy to take critique, self-improve and move forward fast.
  • Innovation - you need to be open and willing to adopt new ways of working. Our processes are constantly evolving and we always look to take a lean approach.
  • Customer focus - You should always be thinking, “What can I be doing to deliver the most value to our customers?”
  • Leave your ego at the door. We make decisions based on what’s right for the company, no exceptions.
  • Integrity- you do the right thing and know how to set expectations
  • Direct feedback- you’re comfortable giving and receiving feedback
  • Continuous improvement- you’re always looking for ways to better yourself and company processes
  • Wellness- you live a balanced routine and avoid heroism or burnout

The skills we're looking for are

  • Attention to Software Design and System Architecture
  • Experience with Object Orientated PHP and SOLID principles
  • Laravel 5
  • Coding standards (PSR2)
  • Composer dependancy management tool
  • Domain Modelling
  • Test Driven Development
  • Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Agile Development Principles

Bonus points for experience with

  • Working remotely
  • Working in a startup environment (especially on a saas product)
  • Knowledge of content management systems
  • Real time web applications
  • Experience with other parts of our stack (Node.js, React)
  • Virtual machines (Vagrant, Chef)

 

BENEFITS

What we can offer you

  • Remote working: work from anywhere within the UK (so long as there’s decent WIFI!)
  • Family friendly: family always comes first, supported by our flexible outlook
  • Work/life balance: we work a 35 hour week and encourage downtime and a healthy lifestyle. It’s about quality over quantity (one of our values is wellness!)
  • 32 days annual leave
  • The chance to make a real impact on our business: We’re a small team of 18 so there’s a huge opportunity for everyone to contribute, collaborate and make their mark.
  • Fun times: We get together at the London office every four months for a team day. Past activities have varied from anything like volunteering on a city farm to doing a 3D printing workshop or just making lots of chocolate truffles :)
  • Competitive salary, stock options, pension and other benefits such as remote working budget and a budget for conferences, books and online learning resources.

You also need to include the word ‘asparagus’ in your cover letter to show that you’ve read the job role (this helps us weed out time wasters!)

Closing date: 31 December 2017

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

items.title: Doist: Back-end Engineer (Python)
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

At Doist, we strive to build not only amazing products but amazing groups of people. Our multidisciplinary teams are passionate about creating products like Todoist and Twist that improve people’s lives. They thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and seek to change how productivity tools are made.

Doist is a global, remote-first company and we believe that our way of working– independent of borders and time zones– is the future. As part of our web team, you’ll play a key role in helping us inspire the workplace of the future.

Your role 

We’re searching for an engineer who will join our back-end team. The ideal candidate is a solid Python developer with a deep understanding of Internet technologies, experience in designing APIs, a strong engineering intuition, and good communication skills. In this role, you’ll help us improve Todoist by adding useful, innovative features and you’ll work to make the service faster, more stable, and more convenient. It’s a challenging task since Todoist is constantly evolving and is available on 10+ platforms with over 50 partners integrations which continue to grow weekly.

You’ll collaborate closely between Todoist’s development team, partner companies, and independent developers to turn Todoist into a true productivity hub.

As a back-end Python engineer you'll:

  • Contribute code to multiple projects and initiatives that make our back-end better
  • Propose, design, develop, and deploy new features
  • Assume a role in planning the evolution of Todoist API, adding new features and optimizing the code.
  • Build more language SDKs for our API Design and build integrations between Todoist and third-party platforms
  • Be a responsible team member: do code reviews, mentor others, refactor code, share knowledge

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 3+ years of professional experience developing for the web
  • Expert level knowledge of Python
  • A background in designing and refactoring large-scale systems
  • Experience with Git and GitHub
  • Fluency in written and spoken English
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and stay self-motivated, or previous experience working in remote teams

We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will continue to grow for decades to come. That means we value work-life balance and invest in our employees’ long-term growth.

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous paid vacation + national holidays
  • Education stipends
  • Flexible schedule and location
  • Home office perks
  • And much more

This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please on whatever schedule works best for you. You’ll also have the option to work from our offices in Porto, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain, or rent a co-working space in the city where you live. 

We invite you to learn more about how we work on Doist’s Ambition & Balance blog. 

Apply:

items.title: Software Engineer (part time/full time)
items.content:
NO AGENCIES

We are looking for someone to join our Engineering team who is able to take initiative and work independently. Our office is in Old Street, London, though we will be moving to Vauxhall next year.

As a relatively small company, we have an entrepreneurial culture and tend to work very fast. You will be expected to contribute in our daily scrum and quality assurance processes. You will not be working on resolving tickets. We want you to hear your ideas and you to code product solutions.

There are multiple vacancies, if this ad is up we hiring.

Desired characteristics:

We prefer those we can work in the office rather than remote though this is decided on a case by case basis and depending on number of hours. For 8 hours or fewer, remote, for 40 hours contract, we'd expect you to be in the office with us.

Expected time commitment 8 to 40 hours a week, based on agreed contract.

Experience with programming in Python

Very good knowledge of Django, JavaScript, PostgreSQL

Experience with Git or Mercurial version control systems

Unix-like operating system as the primary work environment

Excellent English or Polish

Ability to solve technical problems independently

Effective communication with clients and teammate

Able to prioritise and have a ‘get things done’ attitude

Can work remotely on occasion but prefer someone to work in the office with our team

Send an email to jobs@reio.co and state your interest in the subject 'Software Engineer'. This is very important as the inbox has rules setup to filter. Please note, we have a strong preference for UK or Poland based engineers.

No agencies please, only direct applicants.

items.title: Surge IO Inc: Senior Backend Engineer (PHP)
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

About us:

Surge is a publisher focused platform building the future of analytics, demand and content optimization. We've focused heavily on our product (you won't find much about us publicly, all of our clients are word-of-mouth). We have no public web presence. We work exclusively with publishers doing at least 50 million page views every month. Our largest customer is an Alexa top 50 site. We give our clients the ability to view every single ad impression served on their site and tie it back to the exact amount of revenue it generated along with the content that the user was viewing and the user that the ad impression was delivered to. Every single one of our customers is important to us, and we provide an extremely high level of service, continually going above and beyond. We're a small team that's 100% remote.

About you/the role:
We're looking for an exceptional full-stack developer to grow our engineering team. Our stack is modern PHP + VueJS + Vanilla JS. We're looking to move a portion of our code to typescript - so familiarity with typescript would be a huge plus. You'll be developing code that is deployed to some of the largest websites in the world on the analytics side, as well as code that processes billions of events daily.


Requirements:

  • 3+ years experience working with PHP, comfortable working with modern PHP.
  • Strong SQL skills.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to evaluate technologies and use the right tool for the job.
  • Comfortable dealing with scaling - benchmarking and optimization, down to the allocator level sometimes (tcmalloc vs jemalloc?).
  • Comfortable working with a 100% remote team - with distributed code reviews.
  • Familiarity with redis, nginx and docker.
  • Self-directed, self-motivated. Must be able to take a feature from idea to production: architecting for scale, documenting, testing and deploying (although your code will go through multiple reviews before making it out into production).
  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
  • Comfortable diving into a complex existing code base and getting up to speed quickly.

Pluses:

  • Frontend experience - vanilla JS, VueJS, Typescript.
  • Experience with Facebook's graph API (ad management, specifically).
  • Working with extremely large datasets
  • Familiarity with the web-publishing industry and ecosystem
  • Experience with lua (w/ openresty).
  • Experience with k8s.
  • Any UI/UX experience.
  • Any adtech experience (RTB/implementing HB systems/optimizing).
  • Any devops experience.

We don't care about formal education. All communication is generally through slack, although we do jump on calls from time to time. You must appreciate a no-bullshit office environment. This is a contract to hire position. The first 8-12 weeks will be on contract, transitioning to full time after evaluating fit at the end of that period.

Job Perks: Work remotely with a 100% remote team. Have a strong impact on product direction (small team). Competitive salary, lots of opportunity for growth.

Apply:

items.title: Scala Software Engineer - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Scala Software Engineer
Crossover -Remote
$15 an hour
Scala Software Engineer

Are you one of top Software Engineers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $30,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

The Company:

Aurea is the software behind some of the world’s greatest companies, from British Airways in the sky to Disney World on the ground. Aurea and its affiliate companies offer dozens of software solutions that help our clients be more efficient and successful. Aurea is particularly adept at acquiring underperforming software companies and “fixing” them – rapidly reinventing and modernizing the products and investing in customer success.

Aurea is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description:

At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.
  • Willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problem you’re facing

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until it’s done correctly

Required Skills and Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Proven technical leadership skills with 2+ years of experience of development

  • 2+ years demonstrated experience designing and building large-scale, high-traffic & enterprise level Scala and Java applications.

  • Has worked with back end technologies based on both Scala, JEE and latest frameworks like Spring.

  • Experience in developing applications using various AWS Services

  • Good understanding of OO programming and design patterns.

  • Experience with structured logging with distributed commit logs such as Kafka

  • Experience with one or more of the following Data store types: Nosql DB, Graph DB, Relational DB, Elasticsearch

  • Experience with continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery (e.g. Jenkins, Build Bot, Travis, etc.)

  • Experience with modern DevOps tools and workflows such as Docker, Git, GitHub, Jira, Phabricator, Jenkins, CircleCI or equivalents

  • Experience with automated build tools like slot, Gradle or Maven

  • Experience with Node.js and AngularJS

Total compensation:$15/hr for 40 productive hours per week

Location:Global (remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Clevertech: Tech Lead
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

- 75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical strategy;

- 25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients. You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated successful product launches.

___

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities.

 

 

 

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Apply:

items.title: Developer Advocate - Doist - Remote
items.content:
Developer Advocate
Doist -Remote
At Doist, we strive to build not only amazing products but amazing groups of people. Our multidisciplinary teams are passionate about creating products like Todoist and Twist that improve people’s lives. They thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and seek to change how productivity tools are made.
Doist is a global, remote-first company and we believe that our way of working– independent of borders and time zones– is the future. As part of the API & Integrations team, you’ll play a key role in helping us inspire the workplace of the future.
Your role
As a developer advocate you’ll be responsible for cultivating thriving ecosystems around Doist’s apps. Today, Todoist has around 60 Key Integration Partners and Twist has 10 – your role will be to expand the number of partners and to nurture the relationships with each one of them. You yourself are a developer and have experience writing understandable and testable code, preferably in a production environment. In this role you’ll occasionally step in to help code the integrations; you’ll also be in charge of curating app directories and will act as an advocate to promote Doist’s APIs to third party developers.

Requirements:
  • Hands on experience with software development stacks such as
  • Python (preferred), Golang, Ruby, Java, or Javascript.
  • Existing relationships with and/or demonstrated interest in developers and developer communities.
  • The ability to go beyond coding and think about the general growth of a platform without focusing on one single programming language or library.
  • You have a passion for discovering new apps and services and you’re able to implement proof of concept integrations from start to finish.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English.
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and stay self-motivated.
At Doist, we’ve always questioned the conventional way of doing things. While other startups live and die on VC funding, we’ve built our company independently and sustainably. While other companies seek a quick exit by acquisition, our team doubles down on our long-term vision.
Our mission is to inspire the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity tools that promote a calmer, more balanced, more fulfilling way of working and living. We value simplicity over complexity, democracy over hierarchy, and craft over credentials.
The Doist team’s core values are: responsibility + independence, passion + craftsmanship, awareness + balance, team-player, respect + professionalism, clear communication, focus + impact, self-mastery, and courage.

Benefits:
We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will continue to grow for decades to come. That means we value work-life balance and invest in our employees’ long-term growth.

We offer:
  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous paid vacation + national holidays
  • Education stipends
  • Flexible schedule and location
  • Home office perks
  • And much more
This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please on whatever schedule works best for you. You’ll also have the option to work from our offices in Porto, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain or rent a co-working space in the city where you live.
We invite you to learn more about how we work on Doist’s Ambition & Balance blog.

items.title: Developer Advocate - Doist - Remote
items.content:
Developer Advocate
Doist -Remote
At Doist, we strive to build not only amazing products but amazing groups of people. Our multidisciplinary teams are passionate about creating products like Todoist and Twist that improve people’s lives. They thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and seek to change how productivity tools are made.
Doist is a global, remote-first company and we believe that our way of working– independent of borders and time zones– is the future. As part of the API & Integrations team, you’ll play a key role in helping us inspire the workplace of the future.
Your role
As a developer advocate you’ll be responsible for cultivating thriving ecosystems around Doist’s apps. Today, Todoist has around 60 Key Integration Partners and Twist has 10 – your role will be to expand the number of partners and to nurture the relationships with each one of them. You yourself are a developer and have experience writing understandable and testable code, preferably in a production environment. In this role you’ll occasionally step in to help code the integrations; you’ll also be in charge of curating app directories and will act as an advocate to promote Doist’s APIs to third party developers.

Requirements:
  • Hands on experience with software development stacks such as
  • Python (preferred), Golang, Ruby, Java, or Javascript.
  • Existing relationships with and/or demonstrated interest in developers and developer communities.
  • The ability to go beyond coding and think about the general growth of a platform without focusing on one single programming language or library.
  • You have a passion for discovering new apps and services and you’re able to implement proof of concept integrations from start to finish.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English.
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and stay self-motivated.
At Doist, we’ve always questioned the conventional way of doing things. While other startups live and die on VC funding, we’ve built our company independently and sustainably. While other companies seek a quick exit by acquisition, our team doubles down on our long-term vision.
Our mission is to inspire the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity tools that promote a calmer, more balanced, more fulfilling way of working and living. We value simplicity over complexity, democracy over hierarchy, and craft over credentials.
The Doist team’s core values are: responsibility + independence, passion + craftsmanship, awareness + balance, team-player, respect + professionalism, clear communication, focus + impact, self-mastery, and courage.

Benefits:
We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will continue to grow for decades to come. That means we value work-life balance and invest in our employees’ long-term growth.

We offer:
  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous paid vacation + national holidays
  • Education stipends
  • Flexible schedule and location
  • Home office perks
  • And much more
This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please on whatever schedule works best for you. You’ll also have the option to work from our offices in Porto, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain or rent a co-working space in the city where you live.
We invite you to learn more about how we work on Doist’s Ambition & Balance blog.

items.title: JavaScript Software Engineer (Porto)
items.content:
*Software Engineer*

*Overview*

At YLD we believe that in the future all companies will be software companies, and we are now seeing this shift taking place across the business world. Do you want to be a part of realising this for our clients, some of the most successful businesses and FTSE-100 companies? Help define the future: today.

*About The Role*

We are looking for back-end, front-end and full-stack developers with Node.js experience.

You will work on delivering digital transformation projects at FTSE-100 companies, all of them household names, using technologies such as Node.js, React and Kubernetes.

A YLD Software Engineering Consultant is a highly-skilled developer who exemplifies the highest standard in software engineering and enjoys sharing his/her knowledge and experience with others.

You'll be working from in Porto, however you'll have to be flexible to travel from time to time.

This role offers the opportunity to work with some of the most talented developers in their respective fields.

*About YLD*

YLD is a fast-growing, London-based software engineering consultancy passionate about enabling digital transformations for Enterprise companies.

We are a strong proponent of continuous delivery and rigorous testing practices, and we help our customers move towards modern best-practices with minimal risk. We educate, co-develop, and automate, passing on our expertise to our customers’ development teams in the process.

We hire the best and believe that bringing extraordinary people together produces great results.

YLD have offices in London and Lisbon.

*About You*

You will have experience in many of the following technologies: Node.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, various front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, etc.) and an understanding of back-end architecture, scalability and deployments (even if in languages other than Node.js); .NET and Java are advantageous.

Pair programming, continuous delivery, test driven development, and incremental design should be second nature to you; writing code without tests should be unthinkable.

You have a real passion for software development, having contributed to open-source projects and written or spoken in public about your work. You are an active learner, and a good teacher.

*Prerequisites*

You are a highly experienced software developer with a consistent record
Strong command of the English language (both verbal and written)
Legally able to stay and work in Portugal

*Technical competencies*

Experience in Node.js and React development in production
Application development experience of the following technologies: JavaScript, databases (both relational and schema-less), Linux, HTML, CSS and some sort of modern front-end framework
A strong focus on continuous integration and delivery
Strong test focus, experience with latest tooling
Building high-performance and scalable applications
A working knowledge of application security, authentication and related cryptography
Good understanding of design and implementation of RESTful web services
Knowledge of Agile software development process
Familiarity with performance monitoring tools
You can keep a cool-head when debugging production issues

*Non-technical competencies*

Problem-solving skills that balance innovation with pragmatic technology choices to solve business needs
Comfortable working dynamic production environment and take care of client expectations effectively
Distinct customer focus and quality mindset
Willingness to travel to be on-site with our customers
Prepared to speak publicly about your work, and YLD’s work
An exemplar of YLD’s brand and safe-guarder of our reputation

_We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status_

items.title: Sr. Full Stack Developer - Bring On The Good - Remote
items.content:
Sr. Full Stack Developer
Bring On The Good -Remote
Full-time, Contract

Senior Lead Developer On-Demand Mobile and Charity Software

We are seeking outstanding individuals, who like working in a collaborative environment, getting the job done right, and empowering others. We are located in St. Pete / Clearwater Fl area. We currently have games and apps created on the mobile store for IOS and Android. If you are looking to come to warmer climate we embrace you, if you intend on staying where you currently live, we embrace Remote work as long as WORK gets DONE : )

The Sr. Full Stack Engineer will build enterprise-level, web-based solutions, that interface with mobile applications and mobile games/experience software, as well as maintain and troubleshoot established applications to meet our ongoing demands. They will participate in functional specification and testing determinations, as well as architecture and design discussions. They will work closely with the Business Analysts and the Quality Assurance team to guarantee that all IT solutions are delivered as requested and specified and are reliable, free of defects and ready for release. The Software Engineer needs to be a highly motivated individual who can work in a fast-paced environment and be a self-starter. You will be in charge of delivering the end product and will be required to review it on a weekly basis with the owners and mobile development team.

Skills Needed :

The Lead Developer will play a crucial role in the development of our software products. As a Lead Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for driving the requirement analysis, system architecture, design and implementation of eCommerce systems, applications, and frameworks, developing the software components as per design, integrate Front-end components with Back-end services, unit testing of individual components, and utilizing superior communications skills to work seamlessly across cross-functional teams.

This would require:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science and/or Computer Information Systems and/or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of professional web development (EXAMPLES Must be provided and references will be checked). Enterprise web development experience required
  • Understanding of core computer science fundamentals and an expertise in Object-Oriented programming languages such as Java, data structures, and problem solving
  • Deep understanding of client-side development using JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML 5, React, CSS
  • Proven server-side engineering with modern web services technologies such as AngularJS, Microservices Architecture, REST, SOAP, HTTP, React, and JSON
  • Elevated experience with NoSQL persistence technologies such as MongoDB
  • Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases such as SQL
  • Experience with Git, NodeJS development, Docker, Full stack web development, Unit testing practices and tools
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks
  • Ability to deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly
  • Ability to synthesize requirements underlying feature requests, recommended alternative technical and business approaches, and facilitate engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines

Tools to be used :

For this position, you will be required to use tools including Docker for Windows and Microservices Integrated Development Environment for web-based eCommerce application development, Visual Studio Code for coding in full stack. Git and Bitbucket for building source code version control, Swagger API, SQL Server, Mongo DB.

You will use a set of software development strategies combing computer science, mathematics and scientific methods to solve scalability and optimization problems in our eCommerce projects.

As a Software Engineer, essential job functions will include the following:

  • Collaborate with PM, mobile unity developers, designers, and conversion marketing to quickly ship new featured front-end and back-end experiments
  • Implement the design by developing software components using TypeScript, Angular 4, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React, API development, Amazon Web Services, and JQuery
  • Write modular, secure, and well-tested back-end and front-end code
  • Designing and developing RESTful web services
  • Build and conduct unit tests and system tests
  • Provide code review corrections and feedback in a professional and skill building way
  • Make updates to the SQL Server database schema according to the design
  • Keep up to date in advancements in technologies and frameworks
  • Monitor and maintain continuous integration system after the development of new components
  • Resolve technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation
  • Create and enhance technical documentation around systems and processes

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: negotiable Hourly : negotiable

Job Location:

  • REMOTE - our team is mostly remote.

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • JavaScript, Node.js, angular 2.0-4.0: 5 years
  • Sr Lead Developer: 7+ years

Job Type: Contract

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Front End web development.: 6 years
  • MongoDB: 5 years
  • Back end web development: 6 years
  • nodeJS: 6 years
  • React: 4 years

items.title: Web Developer
items.content:
We are a high growth, well funded start up business providing a hardware / software solution to Airbnb hosts, vacation rental professionals and serviced apartments to enable them to monetise their guests through on-demand services and bring an “in-property” revenue stream to the short stay market. We are based in central London (nearest tube is Waterloo) and are expanding to the US.

We are looking for an ambitious Website Developer to join our growing London team and take our customer facing sites to the next level. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and collaborate with a project lead, our CTO, designer and product team. We’re a small but growing company and there are plenty of opportunities to put your own stamp on the project, and the company. The website and dashboard are keys parts of our business that we are hoping to take to the next level so its imperative you have a keen eye.

REQUIREMENTS:
A minimum one year of experience with WordPress or similar
A minimum one year of CSS or similar styling code
A minimum one year of HTML or similar mark down code
A working knowledge of GIT and code tracking

BONUS POINTS FOR EXPERIENCE WITH:
Javascript and/or jQuery
TWIG/HAML/Liquid
Experience with an OOP language such as PHP or Javascript

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible and are looking to conduct interviews over the next 2 weeks. Interviews will be at our London office in Waterloo (SE1) – although we can do the first interview over Skype if needed.

Please note this is a 5 day a week in the office role (9am to 6pm). If you are looking for remote working unfortunately on this occasion we cannot consider your application.

items.title: PhishMe: Sr. Production Engineer
items.content:
Sr. Production Engineer

Posted Oct 4

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg
phishme.com/company/careers

PhishMe is seeking an experienced Production Engineer to architect, automate, provision, monitor, and maintain administrative and production Linux-based infrastructure.

 The successful candidate must have professional work experience. This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc. We actively encourage diversity on our team and overall company.

 Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with Engineering and Product teams to identify and implement solutions that meet production, QA, development, and administrative needs in Linux-based environments
  • Interface with on-site system administrators
  • Architect and maintain multi-site, high-availability solutions
  • Own and suggest improvements to our deployment process and tools
  • Diagnose and resolve production system issues
  • Manage DNS zone files and configuration
  • Participate in rotating on-call schedule
  • Other duties as assigned
The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

Successful applicants must be:

  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team in a dynamic business environment
  • Comfortable working independently and able to escalate problems when necessary
  • Able to communicate effectively
  • Eager to learn; able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly
  • Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members kindly and constructively
  • Willing to work for eight solid hours per day where at least five overlap with 8am to 6pm EST
  • Available to work off-hours as necessary
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
 

Your experience should demonstrate that you:

  • Have experience with Ubuntu and Red Hat/CentOS in production environments
  • Are proficient with configuration management tools (Chef or Ansible preferred)
  • Enjoy automating repetitive tasks with the language of your choice (Ruby preferred)
  • Have experience deploying Rails applications
  • Can effectively use git and understand common SCM workflows
  • Have experience using and supporting CI environments (Jenkins/Docker)
  • Are able to find solutions to technical puzzles with atypical constraints
  • Can manage and support production environments across various platforms: remote (VMs/physical), cloud (AWS), and on-site vendor products
  • Have managed production DNS zone files
  • Can implement and manage high-availabiity infrastructure solutions with automatic failover
  • Managed MySQL and PostgreSQL in production environments (replication is a big plus)
  • Enjoy sharing knowledge via documentation
  • Are knowledgeable of best practices, but open to introducing reasonable technical debt when necessary in order to meet business needs
  • Are able to write code that is intentional and readable rather than magically obscure
  • Stay on top of current DevOps and infrastructure news
  • Enjoy tinkering
 

 It would really be outstanding if you:

  • Have attained a four-year degree
  • Have customer support experience (retail, help desk, consulting, etc.)
  • Can comfortably use advanced git features such as rebase, rebase -i, merge --no-ff
  • Include a link to GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket profile
 

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecommuting expense reimbursement

Location

  • US Telecommute
 

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/1273/sr.-production-engineer/job

items.title: Fullstack Developer - Winners of 'Best Company to Work for' !
items.content:
*Simply Business – Fullstack Developer*

We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis.

In fact, our impressive and enjoyable working culture has earned us 1st place winners in the 'Sunday Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for' - two years in a row!

*The role*

* You will be working within a small cross functional project team consisting of software developers, QA and a product owner to deliver the project using best practices, appropriate tools, and technologies
* Helping to clarify requirements at the onset of projects and suggesting different and relevant technical approaches
* Working closely with business teams to really understand our customers and to deliver features and products that serve them best. We are extremely customer focused.
* Championing Agile methodologies
* Highlighting areas for continuous improvement & driving their prioritisation
* Being proactive in suggesting new tools, technologies and ways of working

*Some things we believe in*

* Creating an best-in-class engineering culture – Agile / Lean / TDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 10 times a day on average) / Cross functional teams / pair programming / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source
* Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’
* Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community
* Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)
* Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our Devs out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).

*What we are looking for*

* Strong backend skills - in any language. We are tech agnostic when hiring. We look for strong programmers from any language background and we know a strong programmer can pick up a new tech stack fairly easily. You just need to be happy crossing over to Ruby when you join us - and we'll support you in that.
*Frontend skills in HTML, CSS and JavaScript (and ideally some knowledge and experience with some of the JS frameworks).
* The ability to challenge us! We love people who come in and challenge us and not be afraid to raise questions and help us improve.
* Strong communication and collaborative skills
* An advocate of engineering best practices
* A strong desire to work with business teams (we see tech and business as 'one team' here - all working together to reach the same goal of creating awesome products to serve our customers best)
* An understanding and appreciation of Agile methodologies

*Our tech stack*

We are currently using technologies such as Ruby, Rails, MongoDB, Spark, Redshift, RabbitMQ, Puppet, Boxen, AWS, Cucumber, RSpec, Jasmine, SASS, HAML, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React, Redux, JQuery, CoffeeScript amongst others. *You do not need to be experienced in this tech stack to apply.*

*What we can offer*

* Flexible working hours and working from home
* A multi-award winning working culture and environment
* Life insurance, pension scheme & childcare vouchers
* A ‘pick & mix’ benefits package consisting of:
- Gym membership
- Private medical care
- Dental cover
- Extra holidays, and more!
* Money back on daily well-being costs (massage, contact lenses etc)
* A fun & social working environment
* The opportunity to work with a best-in-class team who are at the forefront of tech providing thought
leadership and hosting meetup groups in our office and presenting talks on the subject
* Company trips abroad (paid for!) - We’ve been Brussels twice and Barcelona over the last few years!
* Career development – we look to fund relevant training courses and conference
* Free daily breakfast, snacks & hot & cold drinks
* A company that drives continuous innovation with forthnightly and annual hackathons


*Awards and Achievements*

* Winner of the ‘Top 100 Best Companies to Work for 2015’ – Sunday Times
* 3 Star (highest) accreditation in “Best Small Companies to Work for” – Best Companies Ltd 2015 & 2016
* Business Intelligence Project of the Year – Tech, Data & Analytics Awards 2015
* ‘Best Use of Audience Insight’ – Digi Awards
* “Use of Organic Search (SEO)” Dadi Awards
* Accredited “Geared for Giving employer” – outstanding contributions to charity
* “Most Agile Aware Organisation Award” – Agile Awards
* “Best Use of Mobile Technology Award” – Technology in Insurance Awards
* Named in the “Deloitte Technology Fast 500 EMEA”
* Listed in “Sunday Times Tech Track 100” for fastest growing technology companies

*Where we are*

In an modern and open plan office in Bank, City of London.

*Please apply through this workoinstartups website only. This is the only way to enter our candidate system*
*Please apply through this workoinstartups website only. This is the only way to enter our candidate system*

Due to the volume of applications we receive across the entire business, we unfortunately cannot respond to each applicant with individual feedback. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days then please assume you have been unsuccessful.

items.title: Hotjar: Paid Media Specialist (Europe)
items.content:
Paid Media Specialist (Europe)

Posted Oct 4

Hotjar
Headquarters: Malta
https://careers.hotjar.com/o/paid-media-specialist-europe

NOTE: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in European timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

About Hotjar
Hotjar is a 100% remote organization headquartered in the Mediterranean on the island of Malta. Our company vision is to change the way the web is built and improved by democratising user analytics and feedback. Our core product is free and available to anyone with an internet connection.

About This Opportunity
We are looking for a truly ambitious, results driven, analytical and passionate Paid Media Specialist to join the marketing team of one of the fastest growing web analytics startups in the world.

As the Paid Media Specialist you will work within the demand generation team. You’ll be focused on managing Hotjar paid social, paid search, GDN, rich media and retargeting campaigns across Facebook, LinkedIn, Google AdWords and other online advertising networks. You will review and analyze data sets to identify new opportunities and develop actionable strategies to improve growth in these channels.

If you’re an enthusiastic, self-motivated individual with a steadfast work ethic and a creative, data-driven mindset, then we want to hear from you! This is an excellent remote career opportunity to join a fast growing startup in a key position within the Hotjar demand generation team.

In this role you will:
  • Be responsible for overall strategy, budgets and execution of paid social, paid search and other advertising platforms.
  • Create and implement paid campaigns and analyse, optimize and report on their performance as well as identify new acquisition opportunities.
  • Identify new opportunities for reaching our ideal customers through targeting and channel expansion.
  • Design, test and iterate ad copies and coordinate with the team in developing ad visuals and landing pages to improve overall ROI.
  • Test, collect and analyse data to identify trends and insights into actionable improvements in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns.
  • Coincide new ad campaigns to support marketing initiatives such as feature releases, product announcements, content promotions, etc.
  • Monitor spend on a daily basis to remain on budget and reach or exceed monthly acquisition goals.
  • Collaborate with marketing team to maintain a consistent brand voice and message across all paid campaigns.
  • Keep up-to-date on industry trends and best practices and apply them as appropriate.

Compensation Range
The budgeted compensation range for this role is €45,000 to €65,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside. 

Requirements

  • 3+ years hands on experience and proven track record of successfully managing paid social and search campaigns.
  • Excellent analytical, quantitative, and investigative skills.
  • Proficiency in AdWords Editor and Google Analytics.
  • Strong knowledge of Excel/spreadsheet management, and a knack for analyzing large amounts of data.
  • Ability to self-manage, juggle multiple priorities and pay strong attention to details.
  • Comfortable managing large budgets, optimization projects, and developing strategy.
  • Ability to contribute to an entrepreneurial, innovative and collaborative team-based environment.
  • Desire and drive to always be learning.
  • Excellent communications skills.
  • Must be comfortable working in a 100% remote, global and agile environment.
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.

Apply for this position

Please apply via https://careers.hotjar.com/o/paid-media-specialist-europe/?source=WeWorkRemotely

items.title: Full Stack Engineer
items.content:
*OUR COMPANY*

We have a vision to empower all businesses to compete on a global scale. Basically (although it’s not basic at all), we are redefining how people and businesses establish trust across the digital economy. Our first step is removing friction from transactions across the regulated economy by changing how compliance policies are built & managed.

We’re a young and ambitious start-up aiming to dominate the RegTech category estimated to be worth $118.7bn by 2020. We’re early on our journey – you’ll join our team of 10! We have customers, are revenue generating, are based in the centre of London and have raised over £1.4m in Seed funding from London’s top early stage investors. We’re looking for outstanding people to help us shape the future of RegTech.

We have developed a Smart Policy platform to enable regulated businesses to build & manage compliance policies programmatically. Our approach enables the automation and digitisation of tasks & actions previously performed by human compliance professionals. Every Smart Policy managed using PassFort benefits from our purpose-built case management application & third party integration marketplace ensuring that customer compliance profiles can be verified in real-time & evolve with changing requirements.

We are building the infrastructure required to link the human concept of trust with the transformative technology of the internet. Doing so will enable every business (not just e-commerce businesses) to build customer relationships & transact online. The impacts for global economic development will be profound.

*THE ROLE*

We’re seeking a fantastic full stack engineer to help change the face of customer onboarding. You’ll join the current (awesome) product team of 6.

Day to day you’ll be thinking about everything from architecture, security and performance, all the way through to feature UX. You’ll have ownership and responsibility right across the product. PassFort has a culture of quality engineering, and we like to keep on top of tech debt. Building things right will be important to you.

We work in an agile fashion, with daily stand-ups and bi-weekly retrospectives. You’ll bring new ideas, and become an integral part of the process to continuously improve our product, along with our working practices.

Our stack includes ES6, React, Redux on the front-end, and Python (with a sprinkling of Rust) on the back-end. We have a service based architecture built on top of Kubernetes and Google’s Cloud Platform.

*RESPONSIBILITIES*

* Own the implementation of entire features, including technical design, implementation and release.
* Comfortable working across the codebase, learning new technologies and skills as the business requires.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior members of the team.
* Craft maintainable and testable code.

*SKILLS*

* A deep knowledge of either Python or Javascript, and at least a working knowledge of the other.
* Experience with Rust (or another compiled language) would also be great.
* Experience with React/Redux (or other SPA frameworks) a plus.
* Experience in DevOps (particularly Kubernetes) a plus.

*BENEFITS*

*PassFort is an amazing business to work in with a super exciting and executable vision. Our team members are rewarded well, not only from a salary perspective (££ DOE for this role) but also with:*

* A homely environment in our Grade II listed offices in central London,
* An annual learning & development budget to spend on what you want,
* A monthly wellness budget (not restricted to gyms – go for a spa day or rock-climbing if you like),
* ‘Decide your own holiday’ entitlement,
* Pension contributions (investing in your future is important!),
* Pick your own equipment and kit, and not to forget,
* …Equity!


*Sound Interesting? Apply Now!*

items.title: Scala Software Architect - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Scala Software Architect
Crossover -Remote
$30 an hour
Scala Software Architect

Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $60,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

The Company:

Aurea is the software behind some of the world’s greatest companies, from British Airways in the sky to Disney World on the ground. Aurea and its affiliate companies offer dozens of software solutions that help our clients be more efficient and successful. Aurea is particularly adept at acquiring underperforming software companies and “fixing” them – rapidly reinventing and modernizing the products and investing in customer success.

Aurea is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description:

At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.
  • Willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problem you’re facing

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until it’s done correctly

Required Skills and Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Proven technical leadership skills with 4+ years of experience acting as technical lead of development teams

  • 4+ years demonstrated experience designing and building large-scale, high-traffic & enterprise level Scala and Java applications.

  • Has worked with back end technologies based on both Scala, JEE and latest frameworks like Spring.

  • Experience in developing applications using various AWS Services

  • Good understanding of OO programming and design patterns.

  • 2+ years of experience with testing using TDD or BDD

  • Experience with distributed caching

  • Experience with structured logging with distributed commit logs such as Kafka

  • Experience with one or more of the following Data store types: Nosql DB, Graph DB, Relational DB, Elasticsearch

  • Experience with continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery (e.g. Jenkins, Build Bot, Travis, etc.)

  • Installation, configuration and development including work within a production environment

  • Prior experience working in areas of emerging technology and driving new points of view and capabilities

  • Experience with modern DevOps tools and workflows such as Docker, Git, GitHub, Jira, Phabricator, Jenkins, CircleCI or equivalents

  • Experience with automated build tools like slot, Gradle or Maven

  • Experience with Node.js and AngularJS

Total compensation:$30/hr for 40 productive hours per week

Location:Global (remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: PhishMe: Security Production Engineer
items.content:
Security Production Engineer

Posted Oct 2

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg, VA
phishme.com/company/careers

PhishMe is seeking an experienced Security Production Engineer. As a Security Production Engineer, you will play a critical role in effectively building, maintaining and improving the security of our organization's systems, platform, and infrastructure.  You will be responsible for the development/deployment of tooling that will support the monitoring and managing the security in our environments.  You will also work with other security focused engineers to manage traditional systems and network security tools such as web application firewalls, DDoS service, HIDS and more designed to protect our customers and business against malicious external attacks.  

 You will have the opportunity to influence and design current strategies and procedures for securing our environments.  You will directly influence the application configuration, deployment process of our application and create tools to improve our processes, monitoring and application infrastructure

 This role will report to a Director of Production Engineering.  

 This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc. Outsourced or software development contractors will not be considered.

 Responsibilities
 
  • Work across engineering and development teams to establish and enforce security practices and procedures in the building of environments and deployment of code
  • Implementation, configuration, and management of security tooling for hosts and applications
  • Perform vulnerability identification and remediation including patch management for systems and networks
  • Management of AWS Security including best practices, security groups, user access
  • Management and configuration of security tooling including web application firewall, HIDS, VPN, and more
  • Remediation of reported infrastructure or platform vulnerabilities, exploits, and threats
  • Management of user access, roles, and permissions to critical services
  • System hardening according to industry best practices
  • Cross-team work with the various product offerings within PhishMe
  • Provide support to Sales Engineering in developing responses to RFP/RFQs

Your general milestones are as follows:

  • Within the first month – while working with engineers on the teams, be able to jump head-first into enhancing the platform and ask the appropriate questions / do the appropriate research to identify the general functions and behaviors of the system. (You have built out a local development environment and will participate in some of the regular/operational tasks. Part of the participation you will improve upon the process and documented bringing your experience/perspective).
  • Within three months – have proficient knowledge of the platform and be able to take the reins around backlog items and appropriately develop and implement solutions to the platform. (You will have either written a new Chef Cookbook/Ansible Role or optimized an existing. You will have deployed or modified existing AWS infrastructure via Terraform)
  • Within six to nine months – be able to navigate the full stack of the platform and supporting components, contributing directly to engineering discussions that affect the current and future state of the applications. Essentially, contributing to the team at your full capacity. (You have determined gaps/inefficiencies within PhishMe and have written an engineering case to justify the mitigate of these concerns.  You will design/build/document this solution using your language of choice (assuming code is involved) and all system/infra will be deployed with Chef/Ansible and Terraform). You will have completed an integration between Gitlab and JumpCloud to support onboarding new employees.

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

Qualifications

  • You need to be always shipping - writing code, remediating vulnerabilities (or assisting), documenting, solving problems or assisting development/operations
  • Comfortable with a fast-moving development pace
  • Chef and/or Ansible (bonus points for InSpec)
  • Centos / Ubuntu background

Successful applicants must demonstrate:

  • A strong interest in the field of information security
  • A good knowledge of IT security fundamental concepts
  • Actively working / participant in a Devop’s environment

Additional experience that would be preferable:

  • AWS environment builds/security groups
  • Github/Git usage
  • Signal Sciences, JumpCloud, Jenkins, OSSEC HIDS and Zscaler

Preferred Certifications:

  • Chef
  • AWS
  • CISSP
  • SSCP
  • CCSP
  • SANS Certs

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and incentive stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location

  • Full-time Telecommute (The United States only)
 

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/search?ss=1&searchKeyword=Principal+Software+Engineer%2C+Windows

items.title: Software Engineer Team Lead (remote) - Kickboard - (Remote) - FullTime
items.content:
• Kickboard (Remote)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Software Engineer Team Lead (remote)

    About

    At Kickboard, we’re looking for an ambitious, thoughtful and experienced software engineer to lead our growing engineering team. In this role, you’ll be fully responsible for the engineering side of our company, including engineering process, architecture, people management, recruitment, and growth.

    This could be a perfect fit if…

    1. Your team describes you as someone who knows when to let them work through problems, when to jump in to help, and what questions to ask to create clarity and forward motion

    2. The opportunity to step into a leadership role, to help fellow engineers develop new skills and advance in their careers, and still be able to roll up your sleeves and write code alongside your team excites you

    3. You want to build technology that helps educators create transformative learning environments for their students

    Kickboard works to give educators the tools they need to create safe and happy schools where students and staff thrive. Promoting equity is a priority for Kickboard both internally and within the schools we serve, and we are intentional about creating a diverse and inclusive environment for teammates to do their best work.

    Responsibilities:

    • In the first 12 months, you’ll likely spend 75% of your time on software development, and 25% on people and process management. That ratio should flip in year 2.
    • Write code every day. Develop, test, and deploy features across the entire stack alongside your teammates
    • Lead a distributed team of full stack engineers (mix of full time and contract)
    • Manage the agile development process
    • Lead the charge on automation, continuous integration, and security
    • Recruit, build and scale the engineering team, with support from HR
    • Shape and define the engineering culture
    • Collaborate closely with our product team to define, plan, and prioritize our product roadmap
    • Network externally and attend/present/host at local meetups and national conferences to help build our brand awareness

    Your technical expertise includes…

    • If you have some but not all of this experience, we encourage you to apply anyway.
    • Developing, maintaining and scaling SaaS web applications using an Object oriented framework and typical database infrastructure
    • Developing with PHP, React.js or AngularJS
    • Migrating services to AWS or similar cloud services
    • Familiarity with administering Linux based cloud hosted servers
    • Adoption of continuous integration and automated deployment
    • Working with git or other version control software
    • Enthusiasm for incorporating testing methodologies

    Your management/leadership expertise includes…

    • Leading agile/scrum teams
    • Taking complex ideas/features and creating realistic plans/schedule for team to adhere to
    • Technical planning and drafting technical requirements from business requirements
    • Performing code reviews to ensure quality for entire project
    • Keeping a remote team on the same page and motivated
    • Mentoring and growing a team of high-achieving, curious engineers

    Benefits:

    • Competitive salary and stock options
      Work alongside colleagues who love to learn and grow
      Comprehensive health insurance plan
      401(k) retirement plan
      Generous parental leave policy
      Three weeks paid vacation plus 10 company holidays


      How to apply:
      Please submit your resume and a cover letter that addresses the following:

      1. Why you want to be Software Engineering Team Lead at Kickboard
      2. How you approach engineering management
      3. The team you’re most proud of supporting, and your role in helping it succeed


      Equal Opportunity Employer
      Kickboard is a strong team because of the diverse backgrounds of our staff. This includes professional background, domain expertise, culture, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, language, political beliefs, and hobbies. We strongly encourage women, minorities, and people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. Kickboard will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable law.

    How to apply

    https://www.kickboardforschools.com/careers/apply/software-engineering-team-lead

items.title: Frontend Developer - Winners of Sunday Times 'Best Company to Work for'!
items.content:
*Simply Business – We are looking for a Frontend Developer*

If you’re smart, passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex technical challenges then you should apply to join our best-in-class tech team. We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis.

*In fact, our impressive and enjoyable working culture has earned us 1st place winners in the 'Sunday Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for' - two years in a row!*

*The role*

* Working on our responsive website & various projects and pushing the boundaries with modern technologies
* Collaborating with tech and business teams to deliver customer focused products
* Working alongside product and UX teams to analyse business requirements
* Helping us continually improve by suggesting new technologies, tools and ways of working
* Taking ownership of projects and driving them forward


*Some things we believe in*

* Agile / Lean / TDD / BDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source
* Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’
* Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community
* Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)
* Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our Devs out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).

*Essential:*
